loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.en: Vasiliy is a farmer. He raises vegetables in greenhouses. Vasiliy invested his previous KIVA loan into purchases of film, seeds and fertilizers for his greenhouses. Due to this investment, he had an early harvest and was able to sell his vegetables at good prices. This time Vasiliy is getting ready for the coming Spring season. Vasiliy is  applying for a loan of 15,000 UAH. He needs to fix his greenhouses, which were damaged by strong winds, by welding metal arches and replacing film. Vasiliy also needs to purchase fertilizer and wood for heating.

loans.use: to fix his greenhouses, which were damaged by strong winds, and to buy fertilizer and wood for heating.

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en: Irene is a thirty-six year old shopkeeper, selling household commodities. She is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because, in her own words, "I saw KOMAZA as a project of reducing poverty due to the money I will get from the trees." With the profits from her tree farm, Irene plans to educate her children, purchase a dairy cow for milk production, and buy other livestock.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: Carlos de 54 años de edad habita al sur de  la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y tiene 5 hijos adultos. En su juventud aprendió con amigos el arte de la fotografía y poco a poco recibió capacitación técnica, que le permitió perfeccionar su actividad hasta convertirla en la generadora de ingresos más importante, pues cuenta con dos puntos de servicios en diferentes barrios a los cuales les ha adicionado el servicio de escaner. Su meta es convertir sus estudios fotográficos en espacios reconocidos en su zona de aceso y agregarle tecnología y nuevos servicios, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograr rápidamente este propósito. Hoy acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el fin de lograr su primer financiamiento mediante Kiva, pues necesita ampliar su capital   para comprar una fotocopiadora  e insumos de fotocopiaje y agregar a sus instalaciones este servicio.
texts.en:
Carlos, 54, lives in south Barranquilla with his wife and five grown children. As a young man, he learned the art of photography with his friends and received training that helped him perfect his skills until photography became his main source of income. He has two locations in different neighborhoods, where he also offers scanning service.

His goal is to make his photography studios known throughout the area and add new technology and services. He lacks the working capital to quickly achieve this goal. He is applying to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for his first Kiva loan to increase capital so that he can purchase a copy machine and supplies for his studios.

loans.use: to buy a copy machine and supplies.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Agustín invirtió su anterior credikiva en mercancías con la que surtió su negocio él compró cemento, cerraduras, partes eléctricas, etc, como esta es una mercancía que rota rápidamente ha vuelto a invertir, su negocio gradualmente está creciendo en clientela y la demanda es superior, por eso ha acudido a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará tubería, cemento, cal, cerraduras etc. Sus financiamientos han servido para tener capital disponible y responder a su clientela de acuerdo con sus necesidades y exigencias.  Su mensaje a los financiadores es: “Gracias por darme nuevamente la oportunidad de tener créditos para hacer crecer mi negocio. “
texts.en: Agustin invested his previous loan in merchandise to stock his business, buying cement, locks, electrical parts, etc. Since this merchandise sells quickly, he has invested in more supplies. His business is gradually gaining more customers and the demand is going up. This is why he is requesting another Kiva loan with which he will buy pipes, cement, lime, locks, etc. The financing has helped him to have the necessary money to be able to meet his customers’ needs and demands. His message to Kiva lenders is: “Thank you for giving me the chance to have a loan to be able to grow my business."

loans.use: to purchase nails, screws, sandpaper, paint, plaster, cement, PVC tubing, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Law Group

texts.en:
The group consists of two members namely, Lawrencia and Rebecca. They sell towels and second-hand clothes respectively. They have been together from January, 2013 to date. 

Lawrencia is a 44-year-old towel seller. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two months and is doing very well with her business. 

She has been doing this business for five years now. She hawks from Mondays through to Saturdays. She says thanks to ID Ghana for the help it's given to people like her.  This is her first loan and she needs GHS 350 to buy more towels to sell to her customers. 

Both need a total amount of GHS 700 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more bales of towels and sell to customers

loans.name: Hazbr

texts.en:
Hazbr is 28 years old, a married man. He is an employee in an electricity association. He gets a low salary and can’t accumulate a considerable sum of savings because he spends most of it to pay for all his family's living expenses. 

Now, he needs to buy furniture for his house, but he doesn’t have enough money. Therefore, he asked for a youth loan of YER 190,000 to help to buy furniture for his house. He hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to make wedding veils.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Para Gustavo con su credikiva anterior logró mejorar su infraestructura y sus ventas, porque compró en mayor volumen refrescos, bebidas y dulces que rotó fácilmente y reinvirtió. Gracias a sus ingresos nuevos efectos del crédito su familia se siente mucho mejor y dice a sus financiadores De Kiva : “ Mil gracias a todos ustedes por las buenas intenciones con los pequeños empresarios.” En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará mercancías, como ropa, calzado, cervezas, gaseosas y nuevos planes de celulares. Su inversión será exitosa, porque posee gran capacidad de trabajo, experiencia, un mercado que demanda y muchas ganas de triunfar.
texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan, Gustavo was able to improve his infrastructure and his sales by purchasing a larger volume of soft drinks and candy. This produced a good turnover and he was able to reinvest. Thanks to his new income resulting from the loan, his family felt much better and he says to his Kiva supporters: “A thousand thanks to all of you for your good intentions towards the small business owners.”

Now, Gustavo is applying for a new Kiva loan, to be used for purchasing merchandise such as clothing, shoes, beer, soft drinks, and new cell phone plans. His investment will be successful because he possesses a large capacity for work, and has the experience and the market demand, plus much desire to triumph.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as clothing, shoes, beer, soft drinks, and new cellular phone plans to sell.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is a 25-year-old man. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He is single. He is a soldier who provides a great service to the nation. However, he suffers from a low salary. He struggles to meet his family's (parents and brothers) needs and offer them a decent quality of life. He applied for a youth loan of 350,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture for his house. He hopes to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Donia Al-Kfah Group

texts.en:
Donia Al-Kfah Group consists of seven women who live below the poverty line. The women are struggling to improve their lives and help their families by putting themselves to work. 

One of the members, Ashwaq, is a 26-year-old, single woman who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. Her dream is to be able to go on increasing her living standards. She is an employee with a low salary who works hard to provide her expense needs. She is applying for a youth loan of YER 50,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to an buy oven to use in her house.

loans.use: to buy oven to use in her house.

loans.name: Dirianis

texts.es: Dirianis de 27 años de edad es una mujer casada que vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 6 y 10 años. Con ello sueña verlos convertidos en personas exitosas, por eso ella y su esposo se esmeran en trabajar persistentemente para lograr el máximo bienestar. Hace 3 años iniciaron un negocio de preparación de postres y hamburguesas, atendiendo Dirianis a la sugerencia y experiencia de su madre, pues contaban con un pequeño capital para iniciarlo. Con esta experiencia inicial lograron aumentar su capital poco a poco y hoy son muy conocidos en los sectores donde se encuentran instalados. Sus principales clientes son vecinos del barrio y de sectores aledaños,  a quienes se los ofrecen puerta a puerta, diariamente y  a un crédito que recupera  a corto plazo. Poco a poco la demanda de sus productos es mayor y su dinero no es suficiente para lograr invertir y aumentar su clientela, ni para extenderse en otros mercados que le posibilitan su crecimiento. Esta es el desafío mas importante que enfrenta, por eso ha acudido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará salsas, carnes y productos de panificación para tener suficientes insumos con los cuales producir para su potencial clientela. Su sueño de prosperidad es más adelante comprar su vivienda para ofrecer a su familia un techo propio donde vivir con sosiego.
texts.en:
Dirianis is 27 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their two children aged six and 10 years old. They both dream of seeing them become successful, and, for this reason, Dirianis and her husband work hard to give them the best life they can. Three years ago, with some money they had saved, they started a business selling desserts and hamburgers. Dirianis’s mother helped them with her suggestions and experience. They managed to grow little by little and are now very well-known in the areas where they sell. Their main customers are people from the local neighborhood and areas close by, to whom they sell to daily, door-to-door, and on short-term credit. 

The demand for their products is gradually increasing, and they do not have enough money to invest to be able to increase their number of customers or to be able to expand into other markets that could help their growth. This is the biggest challenge that they are facing, and that is why they have come to Kiva for their first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which they will buy sauces, meat, and bread products to have enough supplies to make products for their potential customers. 

Their dream is to buy their own house to be able to give their family their own roof to live under peacefully.

loans.use: to buy sauces, meat, and bread products.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 53 años de edad, vive al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a la actividad comercial; ella vende ropa perfumería y calzado principalmente desde hace 9 años,  cuando inició, atendiendo la tradición de sus padres, que Vivian en la ciudad de Medellín y le inculcaron que debía trabajar y ganarse el sustento diario. Por eso desde joven empezó a ahorrar y a invertir este recurso en mercancías, las cuales vendía a sus más cercanas amigas. Poco a poco fue ampliando su clientela y logró aumentar las solicitudes de pedidos; en la actualidad su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para hacer compras en mayores volúmenes y responder a su potencial clientela, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará suéteres, camisas, ropa interior, perfumes, cosméticos, calzado etc. Su meta más adelante es tener su propio local y aumentar sus posibilidades de tener créditos de mayor volumen para lograr inversiones suficientes para crecer prontamente.
texts.en:
Fifty-three year old Ana lives in the south of the city of Barranquilla and makes her living in commerce.  She has sold primarily clothes, perfumes and footwear for the past 9 years.  When she started, she followed the tradition of her parents, who used to live in the city of Medellín, and taught her that she should work and earn her daily living.

This is why she started saving when she was young, and investing this resource in merchandise, which she would sell to her closest friends.  Little by little, she expanded her clientele and was able to take orders.  Currently, her biggest challenge is having sufficient working capital to make purchases in larger volumes and respond to her potential customers.  

This is why she is applying for a Kiva loan, her second loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use this loan to buy sweaters, shirts, underwear, perfumes, cosmetics, footwear, etc.

Her goal down the line is to have her own store and increase her possibilities of having larger loans to be able to make sufficient investments to grow quickly.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, shirts, underwear, perfumes, cosmetics and footwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to use toward the purchase of a truck.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en: Jean De Dieu is 33 years old. He is married with one child, aged three. He sells different items in his shop and has spent three years doing this. With the loan, he wants to add more curry powder, cooking oil, beans and flours. With the profits from the business, he will provide food for his family.

loans.use: to add more beans and variety of flours to his market.

loans.name: Halo's Group

texts.en:
Halo is a young, 25-year-old, Iraqi man. He is single and lives with his family. He is building up a good reputation and is helping to support himself and his family with his small market shop, selling food and drinks. He has three years' experience with the business and has managed to build up a nice customer base. 

Building up the shop, step by step, Halo would like to expand the business, with the addition of one more refrigerator. To be able to buy the refrigerator, he took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq.   

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. Relief International Microfinance Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for his shop.

loans.name: Sabari Kadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARCELINE représente maintenant le groupe SABARI KADI. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 02 personnes en charge.
Elle vend des habits depuis 02ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter 05douzaines d’habits.
Mme veut épargner ses économies. Elle ambitionne étendre la limite de son activité, s’acheter une parcelle et améliorer les conditions de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. MARCELINE now represents the group SABARI KADI. She is married and the  mother of two children. The oldest is 7 years old, and the youngest is 3. One goes to school, and she has two persons to support.

Ms. MARCELINE has been selling clothing for two years. She gets her supplies from the Sector 10 market. Her customers include women and men. 

She wants to purchase five dozen items of clothing. She wants to save money. Her ambition is to extend the boundaries of her business, purchase a parcel of land, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase five dozen items of clothing to sell

loans.name: Nian's Group

texts.en:
Nian is a 32-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of three children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Nian is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Nian has five years' experience with the small, home-based sewing and tailoring business activity which she would like to improve. Her city often has power supply problems, so to be able to better plan her work around her own schedule, she would like to buy a small generator. And to be able to offer more creativity and a variety of choices to her customers, she would also like to buy an over-lock sewing machine and an iron with ironing board. To be able  to make these purchases, she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a small generator, an over-lock sewing machine and an iron with ironing board

loans.name: Sabiha

texts.en:
Sabiha is a 56-year-old, Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of three children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Sabiha is one of the many Iraqi woman who are working from home. She uses her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Sabiha has seven years' experience with the small, home-based sewing and tailoring activity, making custom-order dresses for women and children and also small, fabric, household items. 

She would like to improve her work conditions and renew her work area to offer a better atmosphere for her customers and to have a better work experience for herself. To be able to pay for the improvements, she took a loan in the amount of USD 2,000 from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. Relief International Microfinance Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of her sewing area.

loans.name: Song Ti Manague Group

texts.fr:
Mme HORTENSE est responsable du groupe SONT TI MANAGUE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de six(06) enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moins âgés à 08ans. Trois (03) vont à l’école et elle a 03personnes en charge. 
Mme vend du jus et de l’eau fraiche et parallèlement du bois de chauffe depuis 05 ans. Elle s’approvisionne par livraison à domicile et aux marchés de son secteur. Ses clients sont les habitants de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02 rangées de combustible. 	
Elle veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne acheter maintenant se faire livrer la totalité du chargement de combustible et mieux scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Hortense is the manager for the Song Ti Manague Group. She is doing well. Hortense is married and the mother of six children. The oldest is 27 years and the youngest is eight years old. Three of her children currently attend school and Hortense has three dependents in her care.

Hortense has been a merchant of juices, fresh water and firewood for the past five years. She purchases her merchandise through home delivery and from markets in her district. Her clientele is made up of people who live in her district.

Hortense wants to buy a supply of two rows of fuel. She wants to expand her business with the income she earns. Hortense's ambitions are to sell and deliver her entire supply of fuel and to better educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a supply of two rows of fuel for resale.

loans.name: Nazdar's Group

texts.en:
Nazdar is a 49-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of four children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Nazdar is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Nazdar has four years experience with the small, home-based sewing and tailoring activity. She makes dresses for women and children and also small fabric household items. She would like to improve her work conditions by renovating her small work area to make it more suitable for the work and more pleasant for herself and her customers. To be able to pay for the renovation work, she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.  

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to improve her work conditions by renovating her small work area

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Mariée,  mère de trois enfants, Madame Korotoumou est née en 1977 à Koutiala, et vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Médina Coura de la préfecture de Koutiala (région de Sikasso). 
Korotoumou n’a pas eu la chance de continuer ses études primaires, pour cela elle s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis à bas âge. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par se lancer dans la vente des fruits, de  légumes et boisson non alcoolisée, il y’a plus de 5 ans. Korotoumou trouve que cette activité lui procure assez de revenus et que ça marche très bien, puisque les fruits et légumes sont des aliments qu’on a tous besoin pour notre santé.  
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle  en qualité et  en quantité, augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a 4 ans. Après avoir pris 5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement remboursés,  elle est à son 4ème prêt  individuel. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des paniers de fruits et légumes au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend. Elle s’approvisionne dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants de Koutiala et effectue sa vente au grand marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle  de femmes et hommes  au comptant et à crédit. 
Korotoumou compte  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60.000FCFA par mois. Elle envisage utiliser son bénéfice pour  le remboursement des intérêts, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
A married mother of three children, Ms. Korotoumou was born in 1977, in Koutiala, and she lives in a nuclear family with her husband and children in the Médina Coura district of Koutiala prefecture (Region of Sikasso). 

Korotoumou did not have the chance to continue in her primary school studies, and so she became interested in revenue-generating businesses at an early age. After having run several businesses without success, she finally got started in selling fruit & vegetables and soft drinks over five years ago. Korotoumou finds that his business brings in enough income, and it is doing well, since fruit & vegetables are foods that we need to be healthy. 

To satisfy her customers in terms of quality and quantity, and to increase the size of her business, she decided to turn toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about four years ago. After having taken out five solidarity loans (group loans), all properly repaid, she is now on her fourth individual loan.

With this loan, she intends to purchase as needed some baskets of fruit & vegetables that she sell. She gets her supplies from the different weekly fairs in the villages surrounding Koutiala. And she makes her sales, cash or credit, at the big market of Koutiala. Her customer base includes men and women.

Korotoumou plans on making an average profit of 60,000 francs CFA per month. She envisions using her profits for repaying the interest and helping to cover day-to-day family expenses. The rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 48 años está casada con Niel desde hace 20 años quien es comerciante y padre de sus 3 hijos de 17, 14 y 12 años de edad. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa.La actividad que realiza Nelly es la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo tales como cosméticos, cremas,  perfumes entre otros y los vende desde su hogar  entre sus amistades, familiares y vecinos, a quienes atiende de manera amable y cordial, ganándose de esta forma sus preferencias. Tiene más de 5 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Le gusta su negocio ya que en el tiempo libre puede dedicarse a otras actividades, además está actividad le permite tener ingresos económico para apoyar a su pareja en los gastos del hogar. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tienen sus productos y las buenas ganancias que le deja.  Por esto, tiene planes de continuar con su negocio, buscando hacerlo crecer.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles para la compra de mercadería conformada por cosméticos, perfumes, cremas entre otros para tener asi tener un stock disponible para la venta por esta razón agradece a quienes hacen posible este financiamiento ya que le ayudará a cumplir con sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Nelly is 48 years old and has been married for 20 years to Niel, a salesman and the father of their three children ages 17, 14 and 12. They live together comfortably in their own home. Nelly works out of her home selling catalog beauty products such as cosmetics, creams and perfumes to family members, friends and neighbors. 
She waits on her customers in a kind and friendly manner and has earned their loyalty as a result. Nelly has worked on her own in this business for more than five years. She enjoys her work because it provides her with income to help her partner with household expenses, and it allows her to pursue other activities in her spare time. She thinks her business is a success because her products are in demand and she earns a good profit. 

For this reason, Nelly plans to continue with her business and is looking to make it grow.  She is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN to buy merchandise consisting of cosmetics, perfumes, creams and other beauty products to have available stock to sell.  Nelly is thankful to those who make this loan possible since it will help her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, creams and other beauty products.

loans.name: Azyikul

texts.ru: Азыйкул 65 лет, вдова, у нее один взрослый сын, живет вместе с родителями. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, в 1968 году Азыйкул начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Азыйкул, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется две коровы,два бычка, 4 теленка и 2 лошади, что приносит в квартал примерно 35,000 сом с продажи молочных и мясных продуктов и перепродажи скота. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Азыйкул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 голов бычков. Доходы Азыйкул планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья домашней скотины. В дальнейшем Азыйкул планирует осуществить давнюю мечту, купить одну семейную машину.
texts.en:
Azikul is a 65-year-old widow with one adult son. She lives with her parents. 

In search of additional sources of income for her family, Azikul started her own animal husbandry business in 1968 with an initial investment of 5,000 som. Thanks to persistent work Azikul now has two cows, two bulls, four calves, and two horses on her farm. Her monthly income from diary and meat products as well as the resale of cattle is about 35,000 som. 

With long-term business development in mind, Azikul turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 120,000 som to purchase four bulls. She plans to use the additional income to invest in increasing her head of cattle. In the long-term, she plans to make her long-time dream of purchasing a family car come true.

loans.use: To purchase 4 bulls

loans.name: Rahat

texts.ru: Рахат 38 лет, воспитывает 1 дочку. В поисках дохода для своей семьи, 5 лет назад Рахат начала свой бизнес в реализации хлебобулочных изделий и горячих напитков(чай, кофе,какао) для торгующих на рынке, стартовав с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному и настойчивому труду Рахат, благодаря её позитивному и общительному характеру у Рахат очень много постоянных клиентов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рахат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на увеличения товарооборота и торговое место . Доходы от кредита Рахат планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса и улучшение жилья.
texts.en:
Rahat is 38 years old and raising a daughter. In search of income for her family, Rahat five years ago began her own business in the production of bread and hot drinks (tea, coffee, cocoa) to trade in the market, starting with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Through hard and persistent effort and because of her positive and jovial character, Rahat has many loyal customers.

In order to further develop her business, Rahat appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to expand inventory and her retail space. Rahat plans to invest income from the loan to increase business and improve her home.

loans.use: to develop a food stall and increase the turnover of goods

loans.name: Gulbara

texts.ru: Гульбаре 53 года, воспитала сына. Гульбара по характеру спокойная и очень позитивная, с 1998 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гульбары в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 коров, 30 голов овец и 2 лошади. Доходы от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляют около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульбара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойную корову и МРС, что позволит ей увеличить надои. Доходы от кредита Гульбара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Gulbara is 53 years old and she has raised one son.  By nature, she is a quiet and very positive woman.  She has been involved in animal husbandry since 1998 and started in this business with an initial capital of 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, she now owns one cow, 30 sheep and two horses.  She makes close to 15,000 som (KGS) a month from the sale of milk and dairy products.

In order to further develop her business, Gulbara has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy a dairy cow and small livestock, which will allow her to increase her milk yield.  She plans to invest the revenues from her loan into further expanding her herd.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow and some sheep.

loans.name: Mamatkadyr

texts.ru: Маматкадыр – 51-летний фермер, женат, имеет 4 детей. В целях обеспечения своей семьи средствами дохода, 20 лет назад Маматкадыр начал свой бизнес практически с нуля. На сегодняшний день, благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Маматкадыра имеются 2 коровы и земельные наделы. Маматкадыр имеет ежемесячные доход в размере 10,000 - 15,000 KGS. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса и увеличения доходов от полеводства, Маматкадыр обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 KGS на подготовку к весенне полевым работам. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в расширение своего хозяйства и строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Mamatkadyr is a 51 year old farmer. He is married and has four children. With the goal to provide for his family with a source of income Mamatkadyr has started his business practically from ground zero twenty years ago. To this day thanks to his hard work Mamatkadyr has two cows and plots of land. He has a monthly income in the amount of 10,000 to 15,000 KGS. With the goal to further grow his business and increase income from land cultivation Mamatkadyr has come to Bai Tushum and Partners with an amount of 50,000 KGS to prepare for the spring field work. He plans to use the income from the loan to invest into growth of his business and to build a new house.

loans.use: to prepare for agricultural field work.

loans.name: Jafar

texts.en:
Jafar is a 55-year-old man, married with one daughter.  He sells food products such as macaronis, butter, cookies, sugar, tea, candies and beverages in his shop. Jafar has about 10 years of experience in this field, which considers him as knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 130 AZN. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of good location, in the central bazaar of his home city. The profit he gains is not enough to reinvest into the business and covering customers' demands is suffering for this reason. Being the main source of income, his profit is used for family needs. Jafar would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose, he applied for 1,500 AZN. He will purchase and diversify additional food stuff. This will be his second loan and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy and diversify additional food stuff

loans.name: Gelaz

texts.en:
Gelaz is a 59-year-old, Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Gelaz is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home. She uses her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Gelaz has six years' experience with the small, home-based, sewing and tailoring activity which she would like to improve. She would like to create better work conditions for herself, which will allow her to work more efficiently and also create a nicer experience for her customers as they place their orders for dresses or other small, fabric, household items. 

To be able to pay for the improvements, Gelaz took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of USD 2,000.

loans.use: to be able to pay for the improvements of her sewing area.

loans.name: Miralakbar

texts.en:
Miralakbar is a 49-year-old man on a pension, married with one son. He breeds cows and steers and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Miralakbar has 10 years of experience in this field, thank to his father who taught him best how to look after cattle.

Miralakbar usually buys calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price from his house.  Milk and yoghurt are sold to the neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings in 150 AZN in income per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes as 'pilau' and 'dolma' and always use yoghurt in sauces. Milk products are considered very healthy and also always present in everyday life.   

This is only one financial income in his family and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved son. Miralakbar applied for 1000 AZN to purchase one milk cow and fodder.  This will be his third loan from AqroInvest and Miralakbar has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Xanim

texts.en:
Xanim is a 49-year-old woman, married with two children. She is an entrepreneur and sells drugs from a rented drugstore. She has 10 years of experience in this field. Her husband is a laborer, and her son just graduated from medical university and helps his mother a lot. Her monthly income is 130 AZN, and this is the only permanent income in her family, as her husband doesn’t have a permanent job.

Xanim applied for 1500 AZN to purchase more drugs for her drugstore.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for the drugstore

loans.name: Khanda's Group

texts.en:
Khanda is a young Iraqi woman. She is 28 years old, married and a mother of two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Khanda is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Khanda has five years' experience with the small, home-based sewing and tailoring activity. She makes custom-ordered small, fabric household items and dresses for women and children. She would like to improve her work conditions and renovate her work area. She hopes that the nicer atmosphere will make the ordering experience for her customers a little more pleasent, and will also allow her to have a nice place to work on her orders. To be able to pay for the renovation work, she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of her sewing work area

loans.name: Nurbubu

texts.ru:
Нурбубу 54 лет, замужем, имеет 6 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Нурбубу занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начатое еще в 1995 году хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. На данный момент в хозяйстве Нурбубу имеется две коровы и еще занимается выращиванием фасоли и картошки.
После продажи фасоли в конце сезона, Нурбубу имеет в среднем около 150,000 KGS. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку четырех бычков. Таким образом она хочет начать бизнес в разведении, откорма и перепродажи скота. Доходы Нурбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Nurbubu is 54 years old and she is married with six children.  As a source of income from her family. Nurbubu raises cattle and works on as a farmer.  She started this business in 1995 and now she brings in about 12,000 som (KGS) per month.  She currently has two cows on her farm and she also grows beans and potatoes.  After selling off her beans at the end of the season, Nurbubu has an average of 150,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Nurbubu has turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy four bulls, as she wants to start a business raising, fattening and reselling cattle.  Nurbubu plans to reinvest her income from this business into more head of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase four bulls to start her business in the raising and reselling of cattle.

loans.name: Ibadat

texts.ru: Ибадат проживает в селе Орке на юге Кыргызстана. Ибадат имеет среднее образование, по характеру очень приятный и дружелюбные человек. На протяжении многих лет занимается пошивом подушек и "тошоков"(национальная напольная подстилка)Данный вид подушек и "тошоков" не неотъемлемая часть свадебного обряда. Первые годы Ибадат работала у себя дома не так давно она арендовала помещение и наняла наемных рабочих. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Ибадат обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нового авто так как возникают огромные трудности с доставкой как готовой продукции но и материалов. Доходы от бизнеса она копит для проведения свадьбы для сына.
texts.en: Ibadat lives in the village Orke in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  She has received a higher education and by character, she's a pleasant and friendly person.  For many years, she has worked sewing pillows and "toshoks" (the national floor mat or quilt).  Presently, these pillows and quilts are an integral part of traditional wedding ceremonies.  For the first few years of her work, Ibadat worked from home, but recently, she's rented a building and hired laborers.  With the goal of further developing her business, Ibadat has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 120,000 KGS to buy a new car since it is difficult to transport materials and make deliveries of the finished products.  She's saving the income from her business for her son's wedding.

loans.use: To purchase car for delivery

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les cinq femmes du groupe Benkola ont  en moyenne 40 ans et 7  enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de N’GOLOFANASSO  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe adhérent à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1er   prêt solidaire.
Madame, Kotimi (1ere  femme debout de la  gauche vers la  droite) excelle  dans l’achat vente de savons  depuis plus de 9 ans et est  très sollicitée dans le village  et ses environnants, puisse qu’il n’y’a presque jamais de rupture chez elle, selon ses clients majoritairement constitués de femmes. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de savons kabakourouni (de 50 morceaux chacun) et 2 cartons de  savons B.T. (de 25 morceaux chacun),  elle s’approvisionne à San auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Kotimi  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 9.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married and in traditional extended families, the five women in the Benkola Group have an average age of 40 years and an average of seven children. They all live in the village of N'Golofanasso in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali) and know one another through ties of vicinity and kinship. They are merchants of various goods. In order to increase their business assets, the group members joined with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first loan cycle.

Kotimi (the first woman on the left in the photo) excels in the purchase and sale of soaps, of which she has been a merchant for over nine years. She is in high demand in her town and the surrounding areas as she is very rarely out of stock. This is according to Kotimi's customers, who consist mainly of women.

Kotimi plans to use her loan to buy three sacks of kabakourouni soaps (50 pieces each) and two cartons of B.T. soaps (25 pieces each). She purchases her supplies from wholesalers in San. Kotimi conducts her business in cash, at retail, and on credit. With this loan, Kotimi hopes to achieve an average monthly income of 9,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and to aid her husband in the care of household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of kabakourouni soaps (50 pieces each) and two cartons of B.T. soaps (25 pieces each) for resale.

loans.name: Olmas

texts.ru: Первый кредит выплачен полностью и своевременно. Она сердечно благодарит инвесторов КИВА. Олмас обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян овощей для выращивания в тепличных условиях.
texts.en:
The first loan, Olmas paid back in full, and on time. She heartily thanks the Kiva lenders. 

Olmas turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of vegetable seeds for cultivation in greenhouses.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds for cultivation in greenhouses

loans.name: Kamiila

texts.ru: Камийла 45 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. В качестве дохода для своей семьи, Камийла развивает животноводство и земледелие. Стартовав с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) 11 лет назад, Камийла смогла развить хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодня две дойные коровы, 1 лошадь и 2 теленка и приносящее около 7,000 сом в месяц от продажи молока и перепродажи скота в месяц. Также, Камийла обрабатывает 0,55 га орошаемой земли. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Камийла обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 телят для откорма и последующей реализации. Доходы Камийла планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота а еще она планирует купить мебель для дома.
texts.en: Kamiila is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children. As a means of earning income for her family, she raises cattle and grows crops. She started this business 11 years ago with a sum of 5,000 Kyrgyzstan Som. Since then, she has managed to expand her farm which now includes 2 dairy cows, 1 horse and 2 heifers, and brings in a monthly income of around 7,000 Som from the sale of milk and re-sale of cows. In addition, she works 0.55 hectares of irrigated land. For the purpose of further developing her business, Kamiila has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 Som to buy 3 heifers to fatten and re-sell in the future. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to increase her herd and to purchase furniture for her house.

loans.use: To purchase 3 heifers

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба  трудолюбивый человек. Ей 31 года. Она вдова и имеет трёх детей. Дети  еще нетрудоспособные  старшему 12 лет, а младшему 4года.  Она начала заниматься скотоводством и земледелием с детства.  Настоящее время она имеет 2-голов КРС. Уже более 5 месяцев она занимается этим бизнесом. Ей  помогает в ведение  бизнеса её брат. От полученного дохода от реализации скота она обеспечивает семью.  Насиба перепродает скот, а также она  хочет переработать молочные продукты и расширить свой новый бизнес. Переработанного молочного продукта она  будет продавать на местных рынках. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки сепаратора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nasiba is a hard-working person. She is a 31-year-old widow with 3 children. Her kids are too young to work - the eldest is 12 and the youngest is 4 years old. Nasiba started working in the area of animal husbandry and growing crops when she was a child. She currently has 2 cows, and for the last 5 months she has been earning a living and providing for her family by selling cattle. Her brother helps her run this business. She now wants to expand her business by getting into the field of processing dairy products which she will sell at local markets. Nasiba is seeking a loan of 1,000 US dollars to buy a separator. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a separator to start a new dairy business

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is 22 years old, an entrepreneur and a single man. He has three years of experience in selling women's clothes, thanks to his father who taught him a lot about managing the business. He started his business after several failures to enter university after school. He decided that establishing his own business is more profitable than getting information over the next four years.  He has his own shop in the bazaar and he renews his stock every month. His monthly income is 130 AZN. He says that the stock he renews every month is not enough, and he needs more investments to cover his customers' demand. 

 To satisfy the needs of his customers, he applied for 1000 AZN. He will use this loan to purchase a new seasonal collection of women's clothes and increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy a new seasonal collection of women's clothes

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Assitan est âgée de 53 ans, mariée mère de 7 enfants et vit  avec son mari dans  la ville de Koutiala.  
Assitan n’as pas eu la chance de faire des études,  raison pour la quelle elle s’est intéressée au commerce depuis à bas âge qu’elle apprit auprès de sa maman.  Après avoir mené plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus, actuellement elle opte pour la vente d’arachide, de la  pâte d’arachide, des savons, des gâteaux, etc.
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’élargir son activité, Assitan  a fait recours  à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de 7 ans. Elle a pris 4 prêts dans une association (prêt solidaire) tous remboursés correctement  et elle est à son 9ème  prêt  individuel dont les huit précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Avec ce financement, elle compte acheter dix sacs d’arachide auprès des stockeurs  de céréales et denrées alimentaires de Koutiala. Elle effectue sa vente à son domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes en général, au comptant et souvent à crédit. Avec ce financement, elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le  remboursement des intérêts de Soro et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.  
Dans ses perspectives, Assitan compte élargir son activité sur d’autres horizons.
texts.en:
Assitan is 53 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. She lives with her husband in Koutiala City. She did not have the chance to be educated, and so she became interested in commerce at an early age. She learned about commerce from her mom. After having run several revenue-generating businesses, she has now opted for selling peanuts, peanut butter, soaps, cakes, etc. 

To increase her business capital, so as to expand her business, Assitan turned toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso seven years ago. She has taken out four loan from an association (solidarity loans), all properly repaid, and she is now on her 9th individual loan, of which the preceding eight were indeed paid back. 

With this financing, she intends to purchase 6 sacks of peanuts from Koutiala grain and grocery suppliers. Accepting cash and sometimes credit, she makes her sales out of her home to a customer base composed generally of women. 

With this financing, she is planning on a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that she envisions using for repaying Soro the interest and helping to improve her family's living conditions. For the future, Assitan plans on expanding her business in other directions.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita is a 25-year-old married Roma mother of a one-year-old child and is expecting her second one soon. She lives with her husband and child within their Roma community; yet, “we consider ourselves fully integrated within the Albanian culture and this has been one of our strongest achievements so far that makes us feel proud of ourselves,” Lindita said.

For the past almost four years, Lindita has been buying and selling new items in the local market. “It can be any items: from clothes of all ages to household and electrical appliances that I sell. I just find it easy  to do that while my husband engages himself in his own activity. I want to save some money to educate my children, because I don’t want my children to be uneducated, like the majority of our community,” she continued. 

She now wants to stock up on inventory items with the loan she is requesting.

loans.use: To stock up on inventory items to resell.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru:
Шерали мужчина в возрасте 28 лет. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Супруга Шерали работает в средней школе , в свободное время от работы она еще ухаживает за родителями своего мужа, так как они уже очень пожилые пенсионеры. Сам Шерали занимается продажей продуктов питания. Этим видом деятельности начал заниматься 3 года тому назад. Шерали закупает продукты в соседнем городе и продает в своем селе. К сожалению он не смог пока приобрести собственный магазин, но в дальнейшем он планирует купить. Для этого он копит деньги. Пока часть его денежных средств уходит на проживание, поэтому он старается развивать свой бизнес.
На полученный кредит Шерали хочет закупить ассортимент продуктов и увеличить товарооборот.Он выражает свою благодарность организации Арванд и Kiva за финансовую помощь и своевременное содействие.
texts.en:
Sherali is a man of 28. He is married and has two children. Sherali's wife works in a high school, and in her spare time from work she still cares for her husband's parents since they are very elderly pensioners. 

Sherali on his own is engaged in selling food products. These kinds of activities started three years ago. Sherali buys products in a nearby town and sells them in his village. Unfortunately, he was not able to get his own shop, but in the future he plans to purchase one. He is saving money for this. Some of his money resources go toward living costs, so he is trying to develop his business. 

Sherali wants to use the loan to buy a product range to increase turnover. He expresses his gratitude to Arvand and Kiva for the financial aid and timely assistance.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Doris Rocio

texts.es:
El cliente  Doris vive en Libertad, tiene 25 años de edad. El empezó su negocio vendiendo sus frutas cargadas de la mano alrededor del mercado de la ciudad. En la actualidad le va muy bien hasta ahora que tiene un puesto propio de venta de frutas y legumbres. 

El trabajo lo realiza con los padres y hermanos. Durante la mañana sale a comprar la mercadería para su negocio. Para así obtener mejores ganancias.

Lo más se le dificulta es la delincuencia, es una mujer soltera, no tiene hijos, pero ella trabaja para mantener a su familia y sobre todo a sus hermanos.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar legumbres, frutas, vegetales. Uno de sus sueños es tener un local en un centro comercial, para que así poder mejores ingresos y poder ayudar en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Doris, 25, lives in Libertad.  She started her business selling fruit carrying them by hand around the local market.  She currently does very well and now has her own stand where she sells fruit and vegetables.  She does her work with her parents and siblings.  In the morning she goes out to buy the merchandise for her business in order to earn higher profits.  Her greatest difficulty is crime.  She’s single and has no children but she works to support her family, above all her siblings.  She wants to use the loan to buy legumes, fruit and vegetables.  One of her dreams is to have a spot in a shopping center to improve her income and be able to help with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Najmiddin

texts.ru:
Начмиддин мужчина в возрасте 47 лет.   Он женат и  имеет троих детей. Начмиддин мужчина с положительными чертами характера.  Он очень добрый и ответственный человек.  С самого детство он мечтал стать предпринимателем и  всегда представлял себя в этом деле. И вот когда подрос стал заниматься куплей продажей одежды и обуви. Этот вид деятельности ему очень по душе.  Начмиддин привозит одежду с другого города и продает в магазине своего села.  Его жена негде не работает занимается воспитанием своих детей.  

Этот бизнес является единственным доходом в семье.   Поэтому Нажмиддин старается развивать этот бизнес и копит деньги на будущее своих детей. Так как ему сейчас не хватает денежных средств на закупку нового ассортимента мужской одежды, по совету своих знакомых он обратился организацию Арванд за кредитом.   
На полученный кредит Начмиддин хочет закупить новый ассортимент мужской одежды и обуви. Он  выражает свою благодарность МДО Арванд и Кива за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Najmiddin is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  He's a man with many positive qualities.  He's a very kind and responsible person.  When he was a child, he dreamed of becoming an entrepreneur.  Now that he's grown, he buys and sells men's clothing and footwear and he enjoys this work very much.  Najmiddin imports clothing to his village from another city and sells them in his store.  His wife does not have a job outside of the home and focuses on raising their children.  

This business is the sole source of income for the family.  For this reason, Najmiddin is trying to develop his business and save money for his children's future.  Since he does not have enough money to buy a new assortment of men's clothing, on the advice of his friends, he turned MDO Arvand for a loan.  From loan proceeds Najmiddin Nachmiddin wants to buy a new range of men's clothing and shoes.  He expresses his gratitude to MDO Arvand and Kiva for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase of a variety of new men's clothing and shoes

loans.name: Vaghinak

texts.en:
Vaghinak is still engaged in men's shoe production and sales. After loans from Nor Horizon he enlarged his production and the variety of his shoe assortment. He produces men's shoes and sells them in his rented stall in a big Vanadzor market. At the same time he buys shoes from Yerevan wholesale markets and transports them to Vanadzor for resale. In this occupation he has been engaged for more than 10 years. 

Vaghinak is the only breadwinner in his big family and it is very hard to support them in a small city like Vanadzor. He saves part of income from his business for his children’s good future. As Vaghinak confessed, his big dream is to see his children as students and after higher education, he hopes that his children will became good specialists.  

Now Vaghinak is asking for 1,000,000 Armenian Dram as a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a new range of spring season men's shoes for reselling and leather for his shoe production. This deal will help Vaghinak to increase his business income.

loans.use: To buy shoe lasts, soles, leather and imitation leather for his shoe production

loans.name: Fasso Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les 7 femmes du groupe Fasso Kanou  ont  en moyenne 45 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de n’golofanasso   dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce de Sounbala et d’articles divers. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe  intègrent  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1er prêt solidaire.
Madame, SARAN  (2 eme personne debout  de la droite  vers la gauche avec wax complet vert) très connue dans son activité  de vente de Sounbala dans le village.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 120 kg  de noix de néré auprès des revendeurs de produits de cueillettes   à SAN. Après avoir acheté son marchandise elle transforme les noix néré pendant environs 5  jours en Sounbala. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au grand de marché de SAN  et à son domicile dans le village. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame SARAN espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married in traditional extended families, the seven women of the group Fasso Kanou average 45 years of age and five children each. The women all live in the village of N’golofanasso, in Region de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and they know one another through ties of community, marriage, and kinship. They have small-scale businesses selling 'sounbala' (a condiment used in cooking) and a variety of goods. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan. 

Ms. SARAN (second persons standing from the right and wearing a green Wax outfit) is very well known for her business selling 'sounbala' in the village. She intends to use her loan to purchase 120 kg of néré seeds from retailers of harvested products, in SAN. After purchasing her merchandise, she processes the néré seeds into 'soubala' in about five days. Accepting cash, she makes her sales retail to a customer base composed of men and women at the big market in SAN and out of her home in the village. 

With this loan, Ms. SARAN hopes to make an average monthly profit of 17,500 francs CFA that will be used to invest in the business and to meet household needs.

loans.use: to purchase néré seeds for making 'sounbala'

loans.name: Enalvis

texts.es: Enalvis  de 28 años tienen su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 4 y 12 años.  Ella genera ingresos con su propio negocio, de preparación  y venta de almuerzos, refrescos y helados, que inició porque su esposo le dio la idea de venderle almuerzos a sus compañeros de trabajo y con el muy cerca,  le empezó a ir bien, poco a poco ha agregado, paletas, refrescos  con los cuales complementan la oferta que hace a sus clientes. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y trabaja de   lunes a viernes y desde las 5 de la mañana a las 12 del medio día. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, para poder atender la clientela potencial, que cada día solicita y su mínimo capital se convierte en un gran desafío para responderles. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará víveres, cárnicos, refrescos y desechables, pues con esta inversión inicia el camino a su crecimiento pues su meta más adelante es tener un local propio y bien adecuado,  para hacer de su producción un mejor momento y atender con la calidad que amerita su clientela.
texts.en:
Enalvis is 28 years old, married and has two children ages 12 and 4.  She earns income with her own business, which is preparing and selling lunches, soft drinks and ice cream.  Her husband gave her the idea to start the business when he suggested that she sell lunches to his work colleagues.  With her husband being so close, her business started to go well, and little by little she has been adding to it, including popsicles and soft drinks, which complement what she is able to offer her customers.  She conducts her sales in cash and works Monday to Friday from 5 a.m. to noon.

Enalvis is currently requesting a Kiva loan to be able to sell to an increased number of customers, since each day more customers come to her and her small amount of capital makes it a real challenge to be able to sell to all of them.  This Kiva loan is her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy supplies, meats, soft drinks and disposable products.  She says that with this investment she will begin the path to growing her business.  Her goal later on is to have her own, well-equipped premises from which to better sell her products and wait on her customers with the quality they deserve.

loans.use: to buy supplies, meats, soft drinks and disposable products.

loans.name: Esmeralda Noemy

texts.es:
Esmeralda, quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de especias y mejorar su venta de ropa, se comprara variedad de blusas, faldas, ropa interior,tambien especias como achiote, pimienta, oregano, para poder darle continuidad al negocio y así seguir vendiendo. 
Con el préstamo anterior ella considera que ha estabilizado el negocio, permaneciendo activa en el mercado, lo ha surtido en la parte de las especias y vendiento la ropa.
texts.en:
Esmeralda wants to continue investing in her spice business and improve her clothing sale.  She will buy a variety of blouses, skirts, undergarments, and also spices such as achiote, pepper, oregano so she can continue her business and keep selling.

She feels that the money from the previous loan has stabilized her business and kept her active in the market.  She was able to stock her spices and clothing items.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Ana Hilda

texts.es:
Ana, se decidió por solicitar un nuevo préstamo, debido a que el anterior le fue de mucha ayuda, ya que tenia la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en el negocio de la elaboración de loza, actualmente comprara productos como leña, barro, pago de mano de obra, nacazcol, pago de transporte.
Ella considera que su efecto con los créditos ha sido positivo, ya que ha comprado materia prima para la producción de loza en la época de invierno, esto le ayudo mucho para la producción y mantener los ingresos para la familia, en su familia el numero se mantiene, los niños siguen en la escuela, Estos créditos son de mucha ayuda porque se puede surtir de materia prima.
texts.en:
Ana decided to ask for a new loan, since the last one was a great help to her.  She had the need to continue investing in her pottery-making business.  She will buy things such as firewood, clay, and nacazcol (a black dye), as well as pay laborer(s) and transportation expenses.

She believes that the effect of the loans has been positive, since she has raw materials to make pottery during the winter.  This helps her a great deal in her production and in managing the family income.  She has the same number of children as before and her children are still in school.  These loans are a great help because she can stock up on raw materials.

loans.use: to buy firewood, clay, and nacazcol (black dye used for making pottery), as well as pay laborer(s) and transportation expenses.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en:
Sahib is a 48-year-old man and married; he has two daughters. He is  a farmer and has been raising seasonal fruit and vegetables for the last 10 years. His primary crop is pomegranates, which are very popular fresh and in juice. He chose this business because it is profitable and the fresh crop is in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made of vegetables, like 'pilau' and 'dolma'. Fresh fruit is served on every table in an Azerbaijan family and also used to make fresh punch.

Sahib sells his crops in the bazaar. His monthly income is 160 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise their crops. As these products are in high demand, Sahib wants to expand his business and produce more fruit and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy  new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Siyoni Group

texts.fr:
Divine fait partie du groupe  Siyoni  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 31 ans et est marié à Willy, un commerçant.  Ensemble ils ont 6  enfants  âgés de 6mois à 15 ans,  4   étudient.
Il prend soin d’un enfant membre de sa famille élargie, qui étudie.

Il  fait le commerce de  chaussures d’occasion  depuis  14 ans. 

Il est à son  septième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de chaussures à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  être un commerçant grossiste  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Divine is a member of the Siyoni Group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 31 years old and is married to Willy, a shopkeeper. Together they have six children, aged between six months and 15 years old, four of whom currently attend school. Divine also has in her care an additional dependent, the child of an extended family member, who attends school as well.

Divine has been a used shoe merchant for the past 14 years, and is on her seventh loan cycle with Turame. With the loan she receives from Kiva, Divine plans to increase her capital and purchase a large number of shoes which she will sell to increase her income.

In the coming years, Divine would like to become a wholesale merchant and see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of shoes which she will sell to increase her income.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel, cultiva granos básicos, necesita dinero para la compra de insumos agropecuarios, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo que le permita adquirir abono, herbicidas, y otros insumos agropecuarios para realizar el cultivo de maíz.
Con el préstamo anterior logro realizar la siembra, aumento sus ganancias y las invierte en mantener a la familia, gracias a la inversión del préstamo Kiva, considera que ha realizado muy bien su trabajo.
texts.en:
Daniel grows staple grains. He needs money to purchase agricultural supplies, so he is asking for a new loan that will allow him to acquire manure, herbicide, and other agricultural supplies in order to grow corn.

With the previous loan he planted crops, increased his earnings, and invested them in supporting his family. Thanks to the investment from the Kiva loan, he thinks that he has done his work very well.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicide, and other agricultural supplies

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para mantener el negocio, comprando carne, pollo, arroz, frijol, azúcar, entre otros productos, que son necesarios para elaborar los platillos de los clientes.
Ella considera que se ha mantenido con el negocio, trabajando por tener un comedor mejor y cubrir sus gastos en la familia, ella por el momento comenta que sus condiciones en la familia se mantienen estables.
texts.en:
Paula decided to take out a new loan to support her business, buying meat, chicken, rice, beans, and sugar, among other products, which are necessary to make her customers' meals.

She thinks that she has kept up the business, working to have a better dining area and cover her family's expenses. For the moment she notes that her family's condition is stable.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, rice, beans, and sugar

loans.name: Mario Alcides

texts.es:
Mario, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para seguir trabajando en la agricultura, comprara abono y nuevos insumos agrícolas, que le permitan realizar de una manera ordenada el trabajo en la agricultura.
El considera que su producción en el cultivo ha mejorado, su bienestar en la familia es mucho mejor, ya que las cosechas le generan los medios para realizar nuevos cultivos, tambien mejorar en su vivienda y darle a sus hijos el estudio.
texts.en:
Mario is requesting a new loan in order to continue working in agriculture.  He will buy fertilizer and new agricultural supplies, which will allow him to continue his agricultural work in an organized way.

He says that his farming production has improved and his family’s welfare is much better, since his harvests have given him the means to plant new crops.  He also has been able to improve his home and give his children an education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is a 36-year-old man, married and has three sons. He is a farmer and has been raising seasonal fruit and vegetables for the last seven years. He chose this business because it  is profitable and his fresh crop is in high demand.  His primary crop is pomegranates, which are considered by  Azerbaijani people as very healthy, especially  fresh  pomegranate juice. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made of vegetable, like 'pilau' and 'dolma'. Fresh fruit is served on every table in the Azerbaijan family and also made into fresh punch.

Zaur sells his crops in the bazaar. His monthly income is 90 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise their crops. As thes products are in high demand, Zaur wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1000 AZN. He will buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is a 42-year-old, married man and a father to two sons and two daughters. His wife is employed, but the low salary she gets is barely enough to cover some of the family's needs.

For the past 12 years, Yasser has been operating his store. He is specializing in selling different types of plastics that customers request and buy for their home use.

Yasser is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to cover the cost of purchasing more plastics for his store. Taking this loan will increase sales and improve Yasser's income positively, so he could live with his family in better conditions. Yasser is photographed in his store.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. 

FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see in fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. 

For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase plastics to sell.

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is a 33-year-old married man and a father to four sons and four daughters. He is employed and also works with his family to plant vegetables that they sell. These two sources of income are barely enough to cover all of the family's increasing needs.

Hamzeh has been thinking of a way to increase his family's income. He has decided to become a taxi driver. Hamzeh is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him purchase his own taxi. This will enable Hamzeh to own the taxi and work extra hours, which will increase his income and improve the family's living conditions. Hamzeh is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing a taxi

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les dix femmes du groupe  NIETA  ont  en moyenne 46 ans et  5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de n’golofanasso  cercle de SAN  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente  de condiments et la transformation des noix de néré en Sounbala. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe  intègrent  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1er prêt solidaire.
Madame, NANA   (2 eme personne de la gauche vers la droite) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 70 kg de néré qu’elle transformera en Sounbala  de bonne qualité. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des revendeurs de produits de cueillettes.  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, à la foire de SAN et dans  les foires environnantes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame NANA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 9500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married in traditional extended families, the ten women of the group NIETA average 46 years of age and five children each. The women all live in the village of N’golofanasso, in Cercle de SAN, Region de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and they know one another through ties of community, marriage, and kinship. They buy and sell  condiments, and they process néré seeds into 'sounbala' (a condiment used in cooking).

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan. 

Ms. NANA (second person from the left) intends to use her loan to purchase 70 kg of néré seeds that she processes into good quality 'sounbala'. She gets her supplies from retailers of harvested products. Accepting cash, she makes her sales retail to a customer base composed of men and women at the SAN market and at surrounding markets. 

With this loan, Ms. NANA hopes to make an average monthly profit of 9,500 francs CFA that will be used to invest in the business and to meet household needs.

loans.use: to purchase néré seeds for making 'sounbala '

loans.name: Nolvia Eliseni

texts.es:
Nolvia, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, por la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, se comprara con los fondos prestados harina, azúcar, latas para hacer el pan y leña en mayor cantidad, esto le ayudara para que pueda tener los insumos necesarios y fabricar el pan.
Con el préstamo anterior logro tener un efecto positivo, ayudo a mejorar sus inventarios para la fabricación del pan, realizo sus ventas, manifiesta que sus condiciones en la familia han mejorado.
texts.en:
Nolvia has decided on a new loan because she needs to invest in her business. She will use the funds she is requesting to purchase flour, sugar, baking tins, and greater amounts of firewood. This will allow her to have the supplies she needs and bake.

Her previous loan had a positive impact. It helped her improve her baking inventory. She made her sales and says that her family's situation has improved.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking tins, and greater amounts of firewood.

loans.name: Milton Jeovanni

texts.es:
Milton, tiene dos hijos de 17 y 15 años de edad, vive con su esposa, él se dedica a la venta de gorras, inicio este negocio como una fuente de ingresos para su familia, el horario del negocio es de 8:00am a 5:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de camisas, calzonetas, gorras, para poder tener más variedad de productos en su negocio.
El objetivo de Milton es que sus hijos sean profesionales, y además mejore  su vivienda.
texts.en: Milton has two sons ages 17 and 15.  He lives with his wife and works selling hats.  He began this business as a source of income for his family.  His business operates rom 8am to 5pm.  He is asking for a loan in order to purchase shirts, shorts, and hats in order to have a larger variety of products for his business.  Milton's objective is for his sons to become professionals.  He also wants to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, shorts and hats

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es:
