Rosa, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita capital de trabajo, por eso recurre a estos para poder tener el dinero e invertir en el arrendamiento del terreno en el cual realizara la siembra de maíz y frijol.
Ella continua trabajando la tierra, considera que estos préstamos le ayudan a la compra de insumos para el cuidado del cultivo, espera mantenerse así para ayudar a su familia y poder proveer a sus hijos lo necesario para continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Rosa decided to take out a new loan because she needs working capital in order to have the money for the rent of the land on which she grows corn and beans.

She continues working the land. She believes that these loans help her to buy supplies to care for the crops. She hopes to support herself in this way in order to help her family and to be able to provide her children with what they need to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the land she cultivates

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario established his print shop in the fall of 1991. For over two decades now, the local community has benefited from Mario’s numerous printing services. 

Mario is currently seeking a $5,000 loan to help him purchase new equipment. The loan will help Mario to continue providing quality printing services to his community. He hopes that the loan will also help expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old, married and has four children. To acquire income, she raises hogs. She sells them when they have achieved the desired weight. She has been in her business for over a year and earns just enough income to cover school fees and daily meals for the family.

She would like to increae her profits; therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vaccines for sustaining hogs.

She hopes to keep raising healthy hogs and selling them profitably, in order to earn funds for the future expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for sustaining hogs

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Posee cuatro años de dedicarse a la administración de su propia tienda junto a su esposa. Antes, solo se dedicaba a trabajar en la agricultura; lo aprendió de sus padres y hermanos mayores. Para comprar la mercadería viaja en un pick up, hasta la ciudad.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar productos lácteos; ya que no posee y los clientes se los están demandando. De esta manera, mantendrá bien surtida su tienda y satisfechos a sus clientes. Con los ingresos, espera invertirlos siempre en le negocio, para mantener su fuente de ingresos estable y que le permita brindar educación superior a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jaime is 45 years old, married, and has two children. He has made a living for four years in the administration of his own store together with his wife. Before, he made a living working in agriculture which he learned from his father and older brothers. To buy merchandise he takes a pick-up truck to the city. 

He is asking for this loan from Fundación Campo to buy dairy products, because he doesn't have any in his store and his customers are asking for them. By doing this he will keep his store well-stocked and his customers happy. With his earnings, Jaime hopes to continue to invest in his business in order to maintain a stable income and support the higher education of his children.

loans.use: to buy dairy products because he doesn't have any and his customers are asking for them

loans.name: Geralin

texts.en: Geralin is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Mabini, Bohol. She has been engaged in rice farming for more than five years. This is the source of her income. Geralin is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and her harvest. In the future, Geralin hopes to expand her farming ventures and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase men and women's clothing, women's sandals, accesories, cosmetics, and groceries she is not yet selling like oil, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Julio, tiene 35 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, está casado, su esposa tiene 30 años de edad, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene 15 años dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería, este lo aprendió con sus padres, trabaja todos los días.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de semilla, abono y arrendamiento del terreno, esto le ayudara para tener lo necesario para iniciar la próxima siembra, con el objetivo de tener más ingresos.
Su aspiración es fortalecer el cultivo, realizando un buen negocio de la cosecha, tambien ofrecerle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Julio, 35 years old, has two children. He is married. His wife is 30 years old. He grows corn and has been farming and ranching for 15 years. He learned it from his parents and he works every day.

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds and manure and to pay the rent on the land. This will help him to have what he needs to start the next planting, with the goal of having more income.

His goal is to strengthen his crops and do good business in the harvest, and also to offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and manure and pay the rent on the land

loans.name: Safar

texts.en:
Safar is a 37-year-old man, married with two daughters. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  

Safar breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products, as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. He has ten years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him the best way to look after cattle.

Safar usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yoghurt he sells to the neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings income of 110 AZN per month. 

Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma, and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered to be very healthy and are also present in everyday life.   

This is the only financial income in his family and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Safar applied for 1,500 AZN to purchase one milking cow, two cattle, and fodder.

loans.use: to buy one milking cow, two cattle, and fodder

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine is managing a store, selling grocery items to the people in her village. She patiently attends to customers' needs, who come to buy merchandise in her store. She hopes to offer more products, but has insufficient funds; that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy sardines, eggs, bread, sugar and coffee, to sell in her store. 

She hopes to increase her profits and save funds for future expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy sardines, eggs, bread, sugar and coffee, to sell in her store

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
Hog-raising is the primary source income for Mercelita; she is 41, and currently residing at San Fernando, Alicia. She is married to Ricardo, a father who works hard as a farmer. The couple is thankful because they had been blessed with four children. Mercelita raised her family through her business. 

She has been running her hog-raising business for two years, earns PHP 2,500 per piglet. 

Mercelita is asking a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins to sustain the proper growth of her hogs. She hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to improve her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins to sustain the proper growth of her hogs

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores, tiene 58 años de edad, está soltero, vive con hija que tiene 32 años, trabaja con el administrando una tienda, este negocio tiene 3 años de existir, lo aprendió con su hija y atienden todos los días a los clientes.
Él comprara quiere fortalecer el negocio, aumentando el número de productos, para ello es necesario un préstamo que le permita comprarse azúcar, arroz, frijoles, sal, detergentes, entre otra variedad, esto le ayudara a que Dolores mantenga surtido el negocio, pueda vender aun mas a los clientes.
La aspiración de él es que su negocio crezca, ofreciendo más variedad y calidad en productos, tambien en su familia tener lo necesario con su hija.
texts.en:
Dolores is 58 years old. He is single and lives with his daughter, who is 32. They work together managing a store, which has been in business for three years. He learned from his daughter and they serve customers every day.

He wants to make their business stronger by increasing the amount of products. He needs a loan that will allow him to purchase sugar, rice, beans, salt, detergents, and other items. This will help Dolores keep his business well stocked so that he can sell even more to his customers. 

His goal is for his business to grow, offering a wider variety of products and higher quality. He and his daughter also want their family to have what they need.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, beans, salt, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre lives in Port Salut, a small town on the coast of the South Department in Haiti, about 45 minutes from the regional capital of Les Cayes. He is married and has two children in school. As a pastor in his village he is also a community leader and perfectly situated to increase energy literacy amongst his neighbors. He has started a clean energy business with EarthSpark and specifically wants to sell kerosene stoves and solar desk lamps. With his first Kiva loan, Pierre was set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.

He used this “business in a bag” to launch a clean energy entrepreneurship with EarthSpark. He sold out of his products so quickly that he has paid off his loan and is now coming back to us for another loan. This time, he would like to continue his business and is asking again for 350 USD. With this money, he will continue to sell solar desk lamps as well as kerosene and charcoal-efficient stoves in his community.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Sakit

texts.en:
Sakit is a 52-year-old man, married with one daughter. He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products, as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers.  There are about eight head in his herd.  Sakit has five years of experience in this field, and the reason which pushed him to start his own business was a very low pension.

Sakit usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. Milk and yoghurt he sells to the neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings an income of 400 AZN per month. 

Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered to be very healthy and are also present in everyday life.   

This is the only financial income in his family and not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved daughter. Sakit applied for a 2,000 AZN to purchase three cattle, two milking cows, and fodder. This will be his second loan, and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy three cattle, two milking cows, and fodder

loans.name: Sarwa Wiguna Group

texts.en:
This is Sarwa Wiguna Group, located in West Bali. All the husbands of the members of the group work as farmers and as Balinese women, the group members support their husbands in earning income, by raising pigs at home.

After a successful payoff of the previous loans, these women are proceeding to the next period with a purpose to improve their businesses. Ni Ketut, head of the group, is coordinating the group members in the purchase of piglets, so that all members get good piglets. With her portion of this new loan, she is purchasing superior quality feed for her sows and piglets, to make sure they achieve healthy growth. With the profit of this effort, she hopes to buy floors for her home, which are still concrete.

loans.use: To purchase superior quality feed for her sows and piglets

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya is 45 years old lives with her husband, two children and her mother in a small house in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband Batbayar, 47, works at a local security service company. Her mother is retired, and stays home. Her older son studies at the university in Ulaanbaatar city, the younger son goes to a local school, and her daughter is disabled and stays home with her grandmother. 

The borrower has been running her traditional costume tailoring and boot manufacturing business for more than ten years. She is well-experienced and popular among her customers. 

She is requesting 3,000,000MNT to purchase inventory for her boot manufacturing and costume tailoring business. She is a hardworking, responsible, and honest woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her boot manufacturing and costume tailoring business.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander, tiene 34 años de edad, su esposa tiene 32 años, tienen un hijo de cinco años de edad, está en kínder, Alexander tiene una peluquería y barbería, desde hace aproximadamente tres años, trabaja de lunes a sábado, este oficio lo aprendió en su familia.
Él solicita un préstamo para comprarse materiales para la peluquería, cremas, maquina de cortar cabello, y otros accesorios que son necesarios para que él pueda prestar un buen servicio, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar las instalaciones.
El objetivo de Alexander es mejorar y equipar su barbería, ya que esto le permitirá mejorar los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Alexander is 34 years old and his wife is 32. They have a five-year-old son who is in kindergarten. Alexander has had a barber shop for approximately three years. He works Monday through Saturday and learned the trade from his family.

He is requesting a loan to purchase barber shop supplies: lotions, a hair clipper, and other accessories he needs in order to provide good service. This purchase will help him improve his business.

Alexander' goal is to improve and equip his barber shop, because this will allow him to improve his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his barber shop: lotions, and a hair clipper.

loans.name: Labanko Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Labanko est constitué de six  femmes qui sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Yassalam dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce de condiments (aubergine, tomates, sel, concombres, feuilles de baobab et de plantes comestibles, …), ustensiles en plastiques et du bois de chauffe.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 11ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bâh (1ère femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est connue  dans le village de Yassalam pour sa vente de condiments de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30 baignoires de tomates fraiches. Elle se ravitaille en tomate avec les maraîchers au grand marché de Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile et en ambulant dans les villages voisins à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Bâh compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Labanko comprises six women who are married for the most part in polygamous families. The women average 42 years of age and four children each. They all live in the village of Yassalam, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and they know one another through ties of kinship. They have small-scale businesses selling condiments (eggplants, tomatoes, salt, cucumbers, baobab leaves, and edible plants…), plastic utensils, and firewood. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 11th solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Bâh (first woman seated from the left in the photo) is know in the village of Yassalam for selling condiments of all sorts. She intends to use her loan to purchase 30 basins of fresh tomatoes. She resupplies herself with tomatoes from market gardeners at the big market in Ségou. Sale are made in cash or credit transactions out of her home and by going door to door in the neighboring villages. Her customer base is composed mostly of women.  

Ms. Bâh plans on making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA with this loan. The profits will be used for reinvestment in the business and ensuring the children's care.

loans.use: to purchase fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Roseflor

texts.en:
Roseflor is 36 years old, married, and had five children. She is raising hogs and sell them at higher cost upon achieving the desired weight. She would like to raise healthy hogs and sell them profitably, which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vaccines for the health of her hogs. This will help ensure good nutrition to hogs.

In the future, Roseflor hopes to become a succesful hog raiser, and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for the health of her hogs.

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin is a 51-year-old man and is married with two sons. He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products, as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. He also raises sheep for meat purposes. Shahin has 15 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him the best way to look after cattle. Currently he has ten head in his herd. 

Shahin usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yoghurt he sells to the neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings an income of 400 AZN per month. 

Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered to be very healthy and are also present in everyday life. 
  
This is the only financial income in his family and is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Shahin applied for 2,000 AZN to purchase four baby cattle, two milking cows, and fodder.  This will be his second loan, and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy four baby cattle, two milking cows, and fodder.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 59 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by a poultry business in the Philippines. 

Melinda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Melinda has been in poultry for 20 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 53 years old and single.

Mary Jean works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, canned goods, soap, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Mary Jean has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Mary Jean aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, canned goods, soap, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Sèmèbougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce de lait, draps, pagnes wax et cosmétiques.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aissata (1ère femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est connue  dans le village de Sèmèbougou pour sa vente de lait de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs de lait en poudre. Elle se ravitaille en lait au grand marché de Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile, en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aissata compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The seven women of the group Benkadi are married for the most part in monogamous families. The women average 36 years of age and two children each. They all live in the village of Sèmèbougou, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and they know one another through ties of marriage, community, and kinship. They have small-scale businesses selling milk, bed sheets, Wax 'pagne' cloth, and cosmetics.

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Aissata (first woman standing from the left in the photo) is known in the village of Sèmèbougou for selling milk of all kinds. She intends to use her loan to purchase 4 bags of powdered milk. She resupplies herself with milk from the big market in Ségou. Cash and credit sales are made at her home and by going door to door. Her customers are mostly women. 

Ms. Aissata plans on making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA with this loan. The profits will be used for reinvesting in the business and ensuring the children's healthcare is covered.

loans.use: to purchase powdered milk

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix de 32 años de edad se dedica a la venta de víveres, sus principales productos son aceite, arroz, leche, azúcar queso embutidos, actividad que inició desde el año 1997, y que aprendió de su familia que también se dedica al mismo negocio en el mercado de la ciudad y de ellos tomó toda la experiencia porque en sus negocios también trabajó, logró ahorros y se independizó, ubicándolo en su domicilio donde es apoyado por su esposa y su sus hijos.
En su barrio todos conocen su negocio, por eso todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche está listo para servir a su clientela a quienes les vende de contado, mientras él compra en otras ciudades del país donde encuentra buenos precios y lo hace por volúmenes. En la actualidad su demanda es superior a sus inventarios que rotan rápidamente y muchos de sus clientes se quedan sin ser atendidos; esta es la razón por la cual acuden a su primer financiamiento con Kiva en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará, productos lácteos, embutidos enlatados, arroz aceite y otros víveres. Su meta es estructurar mejor su negocio para alcanzar ventas importantes y así poderlo ampliar en el mercado, porque en los próximos años planea comprar su propia casa para que su familia tenga un techo propio su mayor desafío es tener el dinero suficiente para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Felix is 32 years old and works selling groceries. His main products are oil, rice, milk, sugar, cheese and sausages. Felix has worked in the grocery business since 1997, starting out in his family’s business in the city market, where he gained experience and learned from them. Felix managed to save enough to branch out on his own and start his own business, which he runs out of his home and where he is helped by his wife and children.

Everyone in the neighborhood knows Felix’s business so he is available from 7 in the morning to 7 in the evening to serve his customers who pay him in cash. He buys his stock in other Colombian cities where he finds good prices by buying in bulk. 

Currently, his inventory cannot keep up with demand and he sells out quickly, which leaves him unable to sell to many of his customers. For this reason, he is requesting his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to buy dairy products, canned sausages, rice, oil and other grocery supplies. His goal is to improve his business to increase sales and increase his market presence. In the next few years he plans to buy his own home for his family, and his biggest challenge is to have enough money to do it.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, canned sausages, rice, oil and other grocery supplies.

loans.name: Lili

texts.es: Lili, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer soñadora y entusiasta,esta casada con Cristóbal con quien tiene 6 hijos .Ella vive junto a su familia en la casa de material noble que construyeron con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.El trabajo de Lili consiste en la venta de verduras y frutas. Todos los días se traslada por las calles de la ciudad transportando sus productos en una carretilla y llamando con su fuerte voz a sus clientes para que accedan a la compra de verdudras y frutas , tales como tomates, cebollas y limones o las frutas más deliciosas de la región como mandarinas, manzanas, naranjas , aguaje entre otros . Lleva realizando esta actividad cerca de 2 años y lo hace sola. Cuando observa que el sol es demasiado abrasador instala un pequeño puesto y coloca una pequeña mesa bajo la sombra de un plástico para asi proteger su piel . Es una mujer que ama su trabajo porque es su única fuente de ingresos económicos y eso le permite cubrir los gastos necesarios que le demanda su amplia familia. No se acobarda ante las adversidades y espera algún día poner un negocio estable y de mayor rentabilidad para el beneficio de sus hijos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles para la compra de gran variedad de verduras como tomates, papas y cebollas y algunas frutas de la región como aguaje y mandarinas para continuar vendiendo por las calles de la ciudad a su vez agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento para que asi pueda concretar sus planes a futuro.
texts.en:
Lili, 55, is an enthusiastic woman and an idealist.  She's married to Cristóbal, with whom she has six children.  She lives with her family in a house made of solid materials that they built with a lot of effort and dedication.

Lili's work is selling fruits and vegetables.  Every day she goes through the streets of the city, carrying her products in a little cart and calling out with her strong voice to her customers so they go out to buy her fruits and vegetables, such as tomatoes, onions, and lemons, or the most delicious fruit of the region such as mandarins, apples, oranges, "aguaje" [a regional fruit], and others.

She has been doing this job for around two years and she does it alone.  When she sees that the sun is too scorching, she sets up a small stall and places a table under the shade of a piece of plastic to protect her skin.

She's a woman who loves her job because it's her only source of income and it allows her to cover the necessary expenses required for her large family.  She's not intimidated by adversity and she hopes to one day set up a stable and more profitable business for the benefit of her children.

This time she's requesting 800 soles [PEN] to buy a wide variety of vegetables such as tomatoes, potatoes, and onions, and some regional fruit such as aguaje and mandarins to continue selling in the city streets.

She's grateful to all the people who make her loan possible so she can firm up her plans for the future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Mrs.Sarantuya is 51 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, in a ger (round, felt tent) in Dornogobi province, Mongolia. Her husband, Tsolmonbaatar, age 42, runs a taxi service in town. Her sons, Tsolmonbayar, age 15, and Erdene-Ochir, age 13, study at a local school. Borrower has been working at a local transportation service company since August, 2012.

Her husband's car has been broken for a while now, and he needs some spare parts to fix his car and run his business without problems. Borrower is requesting 400,000 MNT, to purchase spare parts for her husband's car, so he can resume and run his taxi service business smoothly. Both borrower and her husband are hard-working and responsible people.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her husband's car, which is not running now, so he can resume and run his taxi service business smoothly

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
This is Dante, 48, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Aurcinia, his business partner and the mother of his children. He is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Dante oversees the operation of their Jeepney transportation business. They have one unit of Jeepney that carries up to 16 passengers to their destinations within the community. Dante and Aurcinia earn from the boundary payment (a fixed-amount, daily), which their driver remits every day. Their regular passengers and customers are from the local community. They earn a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in boundary every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, Dante is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will use the loan for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. Dante hopes to have more Jeepneys and dreams of being more successful in life, by the grace of God. He meets with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his family's Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Adonaïm 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTOU est responsable du groupe ADONAÏM 2. Bintou se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 15 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. Deux(02) vont à l’école et elle a trois (03) personnes en charge. 
Mme vend des combustibles (bois de chauffe) depuis 03ans. Elle se fait livrer à domicile. Ses clients sont les voisines.
 Elle veut s’acheter 1/2camion de bois de chauffe. 
Elle épargne ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne toujours acheter une moto et aider son mari pour la scolarisation de ses enfants
texts.en: Mrs. Bintou is the leader of the Adonaim-2 group. She is doing fine. She is married and has four children. The eldest is 15 years old, and the youngest is four. Two of her children go to school; she has three dependents. Mrs. Bintou has been selling fuel  (firewood) for three years. She gets firewood delivered to her home. Her customers are her neighbors. She would like to buy half a truckload of firewood. She is saving her earnings. She still has the goal of buying a motorbike and helping her husband pay for the children’s education.

loans.use: to buy half a truckload of firewood.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a retail rice and charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice and charcoal to sell in her rice and charcoal business.

Carmelita has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from food vending.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé de cinq femmes qui sont majoritairement des veuves. Elles ont en moyenne 52 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Yassalam  dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens  de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce de condiments (aubergine, tomates, sel, feuilles de baobab et de plantes comestibles, …), de grains de céréales  et d’habits pour enfants.
Dans le but de consolider leur petit commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 11ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Baaba (femme debout au milieu sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments  dans le village de Yassalam et environs. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 500kg de feuilles de baobab petit à petit dans le village et  environnants. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit dans le marché Château de Ségou en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Baaba  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi is composed of five women who are mostly widows. They average 52 years of age and three children each. They all live in the village of Yassalam, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and they know one another through ties of community and kinship. They have small-scale businesses selling condiments (eggplants, tomatoes, salt, baobab leaves, and edible plants…), grains, and children's clothing.

With the goal of consolidating their small businesses, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 11th solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Baaba (standing in the middle in the photo) is a major seller of condiments in and around the village of Yassalam. She intends to use her loan to purchase 500 kg of baobab leaves a little at a time from in and around the village. Cash and credit sales are made at the Château de Ségou market by going door to door. Her customers are mostly women. 

Ms. Baaba plans on making an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in the business and ensure her children's care.

loans.use: to purchase baobab leaves

loans.name: Nurzed

texts.en:
Mrs. Nurzed is 55 years old and a widow. She lives with her two children in a ger (traditional, round, felt tent) in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her daughter, Altangul, is a 19-year-old university student, and her son, Myagmarsuren, is a 13-year-old secondary school student.

Borrower has been running her small, retail business in the local market, since 2001. She has been raising her children all alone for years. She covers her family's living expenses from her business profit. She is now planning to build their own, small house.

She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase inventory for her small, retail business in the local market. She is a hard-working, tough and patient woman, who says "I need to save for my son's further study."

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her small, retail business in local market

loans.name: Mamou

texts.fr:
Mariée mère de six enfants, Mamou est âgée de 40 ans et vit  avec son époux et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle à  Koutiala (région de Sikasso). 
Pour des raisons sociales, elle n’a pas eu la chance de continuer  les études, raison pour laquelle elle s’est vite intéressée aux  activités génératrices de revenus depuis à bas âge auprès de sa mère. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par se spécialiser dans la vente de tubercules il y’a 10 ans. Mamou  trouve que cette activité lui procure assez de revenus. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle, elle décida de  faire recours    l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a plus de 8 ans. Après des prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe)  tous correctement remboursés,  elle est à son 13ème prêt  individuel dont les douze précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 20 sacs de pomme de terre et 5 sacs d’ignames à Sikasso auprès des paysans producteurs et souvent les grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au grand marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle  de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et à crédit.  Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000 FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activités.
texts.en:
A married mother of six children, Mamou is 40 years old and lives with her husband and children in a large traditional family in Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). For societal reasons, she did not have the chance to continue her education, and so she soon became interested in revenue-generating businesses at an early age at her mother's side. After having run several business without success, she finally became specialized in selling tubers ten years ago. Mamou finds that this business brings in enough income. 

To satisfy her customers, she decided to turn toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso over eight years ago. After some solidarity loans (group loans), all properly repaid, she is now on her 13th individual loan, where the previous twelve were properly repaid.

With this loan, she intends to purchase 20 sacks of potatoes and 5 sacks of yams in Sikasso from peasant producers and often from wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales to a customer base composed of men and women at the big market in Koutiala.

She plans on making an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA per month. She envisions using the profits to repay Soro the interest and help cover day-to-day family expenses. The rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase tubers to sell

loans.name: Donata

texts.en:
This is Donata, 47, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Henry, a driver, and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Donata operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from those round palm-sized ones to the much larger doormats, and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Donata's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help Donata continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Donata hopes to expand her business and have more products to sell. She dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Virgendina

texts.en:
Virgendina works hard to support her family. She is married, and she sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Virgendina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear to resell. She has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save money, so she can expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Prashanth

texts.en:
Help this tech savvy entrepreneur launch his consulting company!

Prashanth moved from India to the United States in 2005 to pursue a career in information technology. With both a master’s degree in information systems management and a bachelor’s degree in electrical and electronics engineering, Prashanth initially began working in the U.S. as a programmer. However, Prashanth saw the need for highly skilled labor in the information technology market.  In June 2012, he opened Pegasus Consulting, a computer consulting business he manages from his home.
Prashanth offers a reliable source of technical help to small and medium-sized companies, providing both emergency and non-emergency technical assistance, regular system maintenance, software and hardware upgrades, and general network administration.

Pegasus Consulting is quickly expanding.  Prashanth hopes to hire an employee in order to take on more projects while continuing to serve his clients in a timely manner. 

This loan would help Prashanth hire at least a part-time employee to pursue larger contracts and help grow his company.

loans.use: To hire a part-time or full-time employee

loans.name: Jullie

texts.en:
Jullie is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF, to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business. Jullie has been in this business for 27 years, and she earns more income by selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Jullie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business, and to repair and renovate her family home, in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food preparation and sale business

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is married and has one child. Ernesto is 41 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. He grows pigs to sell, to earn a living. He has been doing this for 10 years.

He has requested a loan to purchase more pigs to raise and sell. Ernesto has been a member of PMPC for two years. Ernesto hopes to have more piglets, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Née à Koutiala,  Madame  Rokia  est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame  avec sa coépouse, son mari et leurs enfants à Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Rokia n’a pas eu la chance d’étudier, ce qui justifie son intérêt pour les activités génératrices de revenus à savoir l’achat et vente de pagnes wax, chaussures, henné  et autres depuis plusieurs ans.  Elle est très bien sollicitée par ses clients.  
Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle, elle a décidé de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y’a quatre ans. Elle a pris des prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous remboursés correctement et est à son 4ème  prêt individuel.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des stocks de marchandises constitués de dix rouleaux de pagnes wax et cinq douzaines de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et Koutiala. Elle effectue sa vente dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes en générale en détail, au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000FCFA, qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement de ses échéances, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et poursuivre son activité avec le reste.
texts.en:
Born in Koutiala, Ms. Rokia is 35 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She lives in a polygamous family with her co-wives, husband, and their children in Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). Rokia did not have the chance to be educated, which justification for her interest in revenue-generating businesses, that is, buying and selling Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), shoes, henna, and more, for several years. She is much in demand by her customers. 

To increase the size of her business and to satisfy her customers, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. She has taken out solidarity loans (group loans), all properly repaid, and is now on her fourth individual loan.

With this new loan, she intends to purchase inventories of merchandise, including 10 rolls of Wax 'pagne' cloth and 5 dozen shoes. She gets her supplies in Bamako and Koutiala. Accepting cash or credit, she sells to a customer base composed of women in general in Koutiala City.

She plans on making a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA that will be used to make her payments, help cover day-to-day family expenses, and pursue her business with the rest.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia tiene 54 años y esta casada son Sixto de 63 años con quien tiene el orgullo de haberle brindado a sus hijos una buena educación, motivo por el cual hoy son personas de bien .Posee una vivienda construida a base de madera el la cual comparte con su familia.Desde hace aproximadamente 30 años es una conocida productora de cacao orgánico en su localidad. El inicio en esta actividad fue complicado, puesto que no contaba con una parcela propia ,pero gracias a su trabajo logró reunir el capital suficiente para la compra de una pequeña parcela.Comenta que le agrada mucho su trabajo puesto que ahí es donde puede desempeñar su labor junto a su familia haciendo de esta una labor colectiva.Para este fin de campaña desea contar con el apoyo de su entidad financiera y estar preparada para la época de cosecha.En esta oportunidad solicitará 500 nuevos soles para el pago del personal encargado de la cosecha de cacao.
texts.en: Emilia is 54 years old and is married to Sixto, who is 63. Along with her husband, she is proud to have provided their children with a good education, which is why today they are decent people. She has a home built with wood, which she shares with her family. She has been a well-known local organic cocoa bean farmer for approximately thirty years. Staring this business was complicated, because she didn't own any land, but thanks to her work she was able to save up enough capital to buy a small plot. She says she really enjoys her work because she does it with her family and it becomes a collective effort. She would like to have her financial institution's support for the end of this season and be ready for the harvest. This time she will request 500 nuevos soles in order to pay the laborers who will be in charge of harvesting her cocoa beans.

loans.use: to pay her laborers.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 35 years old and married, with two children.

Joy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase items to sell, like spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, and sugar.

Joy has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food-vending. Joy aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store, like spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, and sugar.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 45-year-old farmer from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in the rice farming business for more than five years now. Gina is married and has five children.

Gina is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and, eventually, her harvest. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La  señora Nicolasa es de la ciudad de Santaní, es soltera, pero madre de familia. Tiene  una despensa en su casa particular, con una hace 5 años, ella es una señora muy trabajadora y conocida en la zona, sus hijos trabajan en macate, es decir en la venta ambulante, y con eso se ayudan.
También tiene animales vacunos y porcinos y con las ventas de estos tiene un ingreso extra. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y creciendo con su negocio, y con ello poder tener los medios para seguir trabajando.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, frutas, comestible y demás, para poder surtir su despensa y seguir trabajando como lo estaba haciendo hasta ahora.
texts.en:
Señora Nicolasa is from the community of Santaní, and is a single mother with a family. She has had a store in her home for five years, and is a very hardworking woman who is well-known in the area. Her children work as street sellers, and help out in this way.

She also owns cows and pigs, and makes extra money selling these. Her goal is to continue working and growing her business, which in turn will provide her with the means to keep working. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying vegetables, fruits, groceries and other items, in order to stock her store and carry on working as she is now.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, groceries and other items.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La Sra Herminia tiene 37 años, es de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, y comenta que se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa en su casa, en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día.
Cuenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que luego fue creciendo y hoy en día ya es muy conocida en el barrio y tiene ya muy buena clientela, que siempre compra de ella los productos que vende.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas, verduras, bebidas, carnes y demás insumos para poder seguir tendiendo bien surtida su despensa y así cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Herminia is 37 years old, and is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. She explains that she makes a living as a shopkeeper, with a store in her home in which she works every day from very early in the morning.

She says that she began with a small business, which grew and grew, and which is very well-known in the area today and has a lot of customers, who always come to her to buy the products she sells.

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying fruit, vegetables, drinks, meat and other products, in order to continue having a well-stocked shop and meet her customer's orders.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, drinks, meat and other items.

loans.name: Lecene

texts.en:
Lecene lives in the town of Port Salut, in the South Department of Haiti. He has had a store for 14 years that sells cell phone credit and motorcycle and bicycle parts. He has one employee in his store. He has started a clean energy business with EarthSpark to expand his current business and hopefully be able to employ more staff. 
With his first Kiva loan,Lecene was set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.He used this “business in a bag” to launch a clean energy entrepreneurship with EarthSpark. He sold out of his products so quickly that he has paid off his loan and is now coming back to us for another loan. This time, he would like to grow his business up and is asking for 450 USD. With this money, he will continue to sell solar desk lamps and efficient stoves.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Jose Vidal

texts.es:
José, tiene 69 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, está casado, su esposa tiene 55 años de edad, José se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, trabaja todos los días en esta actividad, del cultivo de maíz vende la milpa en elote, él aprendió estas actividades por su padre con quien desde joven lo realiza.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como semilla, abono y tambien pagara el arrendamiento de la tierra, esta inversión le ayudara a tener un lugar seguro donde realizar la próxima siembra y tener los insumos necesarios para aplicarlos.
Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 69 years old and has three children with his wife, who is 55 years old. José works in agriculture and cattle raising, activities at which he works every day. From his corn crop he sells corn by the ear. He learned these activities from his father, with whom he worked since he was young.

José is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds and fertilizer as well as to pay the rent on the land. This loan will help him have a secure place for the next sowing season and to have the agricultural supplies needed to cultivate it. His goal is to strengthen his business and provide a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds and fertilizer and to rent land.

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Madame Rokia est une femme mariée de 43 ans et mère de 6 enfants.  Elle vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni. 
N’ayant pas frequentée l’école moderne, très vite elle décida de s’intéresser aux  activités génératrices  de revenus auprès de sa soeur pour apprendre les activités  d’achat et de vente de tasses, de  chaussures et d’habits.  Avec une expérience de plus de 10 ans, elle maitrise son activité.  Après 5 prêts solidaires avec une association de son  quartier,  elle est à son 2 eme  prêt individuel.  
Dans le cadre de l’élargissement de ses activités, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’acheter, 15 douzaines de tasses, 10 pièces de tissus.  Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et effectue ses ventes  à la maison, au marché et en ambulant dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni.
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 65.000 FCFA.  Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Rokia is a 43-year-old married woman, who is mother to six children. She lives with her husband and her children in the Massablacoura neighborhood of Bougouni. As she did not receive a modern education, she quickly decided to become involved in profit-making activities, and her sister taught her how to buy and sell containers, footwear and clothing. With more than ten years’ experience, she now masters her business. 

Rokia had five previous group loans with an association from her neighborhood, and is now on her second individual loan. In order to expand her business, she decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso to buy 15 dozen containers and ten lengths of fabric. She gets her supplies in Burkina Faso, and works from home, in the market, and on the street throughout Bougouni’s various neighborhoods.

With this loan, Rokia plans to make a monthly profit of 65,000 francs CFA. With this profit, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy containers and fabric.

loans.name: Julia Catalina

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 53 años, nació en un hogar de una pequeña ciudad de Loja, su familia era de escasos recursos económicos, por lo que solo pudieron apoyar a Julia hasta que termine la escuela primaria y adquiriera los conocimientos básicos. Se casó muy joven con José que ahora tiene 63 años y es agricultor y con quién tuvo 5 hijos a quienes les dieron todo lo necesario hasta que puedan independizarse y trabajar por sí solos. Julia actualmente vive con su esposo José en el Cantón Santo Domingo de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. Santo Domingo se encuentra conectando la Región Sierra con la Región Costa del Ecuador siendo un punto estratégico de comercio y una zona muy conveniente para grandes y pequeños empresarios.
Julia desde que se casó fue una mujer dedicada a su hogar y ayudando a su esposo con el mantenimiento de los cultivos. Sin embargo hace 9 años vio que la necesidad en su hogar había crecido, mucho más cuando le detectaron cáncer en su útero y ha tenido que cubrir varios rubros por este tratamiento. Para Julia pudo ser fácil darse por vencida y usar como pretexto su enfermedad para dejar de trabajar, sin embargo, esta mujer no se ha detenido a pesar de su edad y su enfermedad, ella cada día sale a recorrer las largas calles de su ciudad para ofrecer ropa casual, manteles, cortinas a sus clientes y además para cobrar los saldos pendientes de anteriores ventas. Julia requiere crecer en su negocio para lo cual necesita surtir la mercadería que tiene, esto le ayudará a incrementar sus ingresos y así poder cubrir exámenes de laboratorio, medicinas y alimentación especial que le exige su tratamiento del cáncer. Para lograr comprar esta mercadería, Julia requiere un préstamo que lo usará en comprar surtido de ropa y productos. Gracias a la recomendación de varios amigos de la zona, Julia acudió a Fundación Alternativa, quienes además de la agilidad y confianza, le han facilitado un ejecutivo con quien ha tenido mucha afinidad. Es su primer crédito y espera ser puntual en sus pagos. Además agradece a Kiva quienes hacen posible que su actividad sea financiada.
texts.en:
Julia is 53 years old and was born in a small part of the city of Loja.  Her family was of limited financial resources so they were only able to pay for her to complete elementary school and receive a basic education.  She married Jose when she was very young.  He’s now 63 years old and a farmer.  They have five children and have provided them with everything they needed so that they could become independent and work on their own.  She currently lives with her husband in the Santo Domingo settlement of the Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas province.  Santo Domingo is located along the mountain and coastal regions of Ecuador, and is in a commercially strategic zone, very convenient for large and small entrepreneurs.

Julia has been a housewife since she married and has also been helping her husband work on the crops.  However nine years ago she saw that the household needs had increased greatly when she was diagnosed with uterine cancer and she had to cover various costs for this treatment.  It would have been easy for Julia to give up and use her illness as a reason to quit working, however this woman has not slowed down despite her age and illness.  Each day she goes out to walk along the streets of her city and offer casual clothing, table cloths, and curtains to her customers and also to collect on bills from previous sales.  Julia needs to grow her business and needs more merchandise.  This will help her increase her income and be able to cover the cost of her lab fees, medicine, and special food that her cancer treatment requires.  Julia needs this loan to be able to buy clothing and products.  Thanks to some of her friends’ recommendations Julia has approached Fundación Alternativa, who aside from the speed and trust, have they have made this loan possible very easily.  This is her first loan and she expects to be on time with her payments.  She is grateful to Kiva, who has made this loan possible.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 28 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy responsable, esta casada hace 13 años con Pascual con quien tiene 3 hijos de 11, 7 y 2 años de edad, junto a ellos vive en su casa propio, la cual fue construida con mucho esfuerzo. Reyna trabaja brindando servicio de mantenimiento, cambio de repuestos y limpieza de motores a los barcos del  rio principal. Tiene su negocio instalado en una balsa flotante asentado en el río que se divisa desde la ciudad.  Su trabajo le brinda buenos ingresos y se siente muy tranquila ejerciendo ésta función junto a su esposo con quien lleva un promedio de tres años en esta actividad . Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que sus clientes siempre se quedan complacidos y a su vez los pasajeros viajan seguros hacia su destino. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200 soles para la compra de  repuestos como anillos, pistones, monoblock entre otros , cuya inversión sobrepasa generalmente los 2000 a 3000 soles. A su vez está muy contenta de saber que existen personas que le brindan un apoyo financiero y que le permitirá estar más tranquila y avanzar con sus planes de su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Reyna is a 28-year old kind, good and responsible woman. She's been married to Pascual for 13 years and together they have three children aged 11, 7 and 2. They all live in their own house, which was built with a lot of effort. Reyna works providing maintenance services, replacement parts' changes and motor cleaning to the boats in the main river. Her business is set up in a floating raft in the river that can be seen from the city. Her job gives her good income and she feels very calm performing this role with her husband, with whom she's worked for 3 years. She enjoys what she does as her clients are always satisfied and the passengers travel safely to their destinations. 

She's requesting 1,200 soles to buy replacement parts such as rings, valves and monoblocks, among others, which normally require an investment of 2,000 to 3,000 soles. She's also very happy to know that there are people willing to provide financial support that will allow her to feel secure and to advance her business plans. She also commits to punctually comply with her payments.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for aquatic transportation.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is married. She is 52 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Rosita owns and operates a rice mill. She has had this business for 26 years. Each month, she earns approximately 30,000 PHP. She has requested a loan to purchase equipment for milling services. Rosita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for milling services

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, a 58-year-old married mother of two, lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay where she has been selling rice to earn a living for 10 years, making PHP 5000 each moth. Having recently become a member of PMPC, she has requested a loan to purchase more sacks of rice for her retail business.

In the future, Victoria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice for her retail business.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina, a 58-year-old married mother of six, lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay where she has been buying and selling rice for the past year to make a living, earning PHP 5000 each month. Having recently become a member of PMPC, she has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more sacks of rice to retail.

In the future, Marlina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les femmes  du groupe  Badegna  ont  une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans, 2 enfants vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
A travers les activités de commerce, l’amitié et le voisinage, ces dames se sont connues. Pour développer leur capacité financière afin de mieux mener leur commerce, elles ont adhéré  à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième cycle de  prêt et tous les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursement. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de chaussures, d’habillements  et de condiments dans le marché de Bougouni. 
Mah, qui debout à l’êxtrême droite sur la photo fait l’achat vente des chaussures et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 125 paires de chaussures  toutes qualités confondues auprès des grossistes de Bougouni pour ensuite les revendre en  dans le grand marché de Bougouni et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000FCFA qui sera  utilisé dans l’éducation des enfants et le remboursement du prêt.
texts.en:
All of them married, the women of the group Badegna average 25 years of age and two children each, living for the most part in traditional families in the Massablacoura district of Bougouni City. These women know one another through ties of commerce, friendship, and community. To develop their financial capacity, so as to carry out their commerce better, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third loan cycle. The previous loans were all correctly prepaid. This group of women does commerce in shoes, clothing, and condiments at the Bougouni market. 

Mah, who is standing at the far right in the photo, buys and sells shoes and intends to use her loan to purchase 125 pairs of shoes of any quality from Bougouni wholesalers. Then she will resell them at the big market of Bougouni and from home where she accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be used for the children's education and for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia de 35 años esta casada con Claudio de 43 años y juntos tienen 3 hijos David, José y Juan.Es poseedora de una vivienda construida a base de madera en la cual comparten juntos sus vivencias familiares.Siempre pendiente del la economía familiar se inicio en la producción de cacao orgánico , lleva 15 años de trabajo imparable.Desempeña su labor junto a Claudio con quien en ocasiones convoca a jornaleros del lugar para agilizar las tareas colectivas en cuanto a la producción de cacao esperando obtener una buena producción.Comenta que le agrada su labor puesto que con el tiempo ha logrado consolidarlo mucho más.Hace poco termino con las plantaciones de almácigo el cual según la regla técnica de producción deben de contar con algún tipo de sombra para optimizar su crecimiento.Sus objetivos económicos a largo plazo apuntan a la compra de una parcela adicional para la producción integral de barbasco.Para esta ocasión requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de árboles de sombra permanente y la contrata de jornaleros para proceder con el respectivo sembrado teniendo en cuenta los requisitos técnicos que se requiere.
texts.en:
Lidia is 35 years old and married to Claudio, who is 43. Together they have boys named David, José, and Juan. Lidia is the owner of a wooden house in which their share their experiences as a family. Because she is always looking out for the family economy, she began to work producing organic cocoa fifteen years ago and has not stopped.

She does her work together with Claudio and on occasion call on the help of labourers to speed up their work producing cocoa and hoping to get a good product. Lidia says that she likes her work and has been able to strengthen it over time. They have recently finished planting the seedlings, which according to the technical rules of production are required to be covered by some kind of shade in order to optimize their growth. 

Lidia and Claudio's long-term economic objectives aim towards the purchase of an additional plot of land for the production of barbasco. 

At this time, they are asking for 1000 soles in order to buy trees that will provide permanent shade to the cocoa plants, and to contract workers in order to continue with the respective planting and the technical elements required.

loans.use: to buy trees and pay her workers

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge  tiene 44 años,  El Sr. Jorge  se dedica  a la   fabricación de variedad de Calzados, para varones, tiene su taller en la zona de Alto Lima  de la  ciudad de El Alto,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia  dentro de la institución, El Sr. Jorge  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de lonjas de cuero por mayor y materiales para la fabricación de sus calzados  y así de esta manera ofrecer variedad de calzados a su clientela, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Jorge  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de material, El Sr. Jorge  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: Señor Jorge is 44 years old. He makes a variety of shoes for men. He has his workshop in the Alto Lima zone of El Alto. This loan is his first one with this institution. Sr. Jorge is going to use the loan to purchase pieces of leather wholesale and other materials to make his shoes, and in this way he can offer a variety of shoes to his customers. He is applying for this loan to continue improving his business. Sr. Jorge is going to use the earnings to continue buying a variety of material. He is a very hard-working person, and he feels happy about the opportunity offered to him, since this is the only activity that allows him to support himself.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make shoes.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les femmes  du groupe  Badegna  ont  une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans,  3 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des familles nucléaires dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
A travers les activités de commerce et  le voisinage, ces femmes se sont connues. Pour développer leur capacité financière afin de mieux mener leur commerce, elles adhérent  à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier cycle de  prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de poisson et de condiments dans le marché de Bougouni. 
Lalla, qui est la seule assise, fait l’achat vente des condiments et compte acheter avec son  prêt, deux catons de cube maggi et deux  paniers de 25 kilos de tomates. Elle effectue ses ventes dans le grand marché de Bougouni, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement  de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA dont une partie sera  investi dans l’activité et l’autre partie sera  utilisée pour les frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The female members of the Badegna group are all married, and have an average age of 29. They have an average of three children each, and mainly live in nuclear families in the Massablacoura neighborhood in the city of Bougouni. These women know each other through their businesses and because they are neighbors.  To develop their financial capacity so that they can better run their businesses, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, and are on their first loan cycle. 

This group of women works selling fish and seasonings in Bougouni market. Lalla, who is the only woman seated in the photo, buys and sells seasonings. With her loan, she plans to buy two boxes of bouillon cubes and two 25-kilo baskets of tomatoes. She sells her goods in the Grand Market of Bougouni, selling on a cash and credit basis to customers who are mostly female. Lalla hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA, part of which will be invested in her business. She plans to invest the rest in her children’s healthcare expenses.

loans.use: To buy seasonings.

loans.name: Rose Eden

texts.en:
This is Rose Eden. She previously accessed a PHP 18,000 loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in meeting her children’s education costs and her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy additional supplies and merchandise products, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rose Eden hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Cory De Los Angeles

texts.es: Cory de 19 años vive al sur occidente de la ciudad y se dedica al comercio de cosméticos y a la venta de carnes frías, Desde hace un año, inició su negocio por la necesidad de mejorar sus condiciones de bienestar y tener sus propios ingresos. Ella tiene un local comercial donde ofrece a crédito y de contado carnes frías, como salchichón, mortadela, jamón y vende a crédito perfumes, cosméticos y productos capilares. Sus principales clientes   son operarios que trabajan en empresas en los que reposa la mayor parte de sus cuentas por cobrar que se constituye en su principal capital. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará carnes frias negocio en el cual está viendo más rápidamente la recuperación de la inversión y genera una mayor rentabilidad y rotación del efectivo. Su meta más adelante es tener mayor ampliación en su local y aumentar el volumen de clientela , para lograr apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Cory, 19, lives in the southwestern part of the city. She earns a living selling cosmetics and cold cuts. 

One year ago, she started her business out of necessity in order to improve her living conditions and have her own earnings. She has a local store where she sells perfumes, cosmetics, and hair products on credit, and she sells cold cuts, like spice sausage, bologna on credit or cash. Most of her credit accounts are with employees of various businesses which bring in most of her earnings.

This is the exact reason why she is asking for a Kiva Loan. It is the first loan that she has requested from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through which she will buy cold cuts. The business where she works is seeing a rapid investment turn, generating more profit, and bringing in more cash.

Her goal later on is to have a larger business and grow her customer base so that she can support her family with their living expenses.

loans.use: to buy cold cuts.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 32-year-old farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol.  She is married and has four young children. 

Gina helps her husband in cultivating their farm.  At this time, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her rice field and eventually her harvest.

In the future, Gina has hopes of making her business a success and saving money for the educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Loudilo

texts.en:
Loudilo is 37-years-old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

Loudilo is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Loudilo requested a PHP 11000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Loudilo has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Loudilo would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide is married with one child. Heide is 43 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Heide sells products such as canned goods, noodles, etc. to earn a living, and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, Heide earns PHP 3000 doing this type of work.  Heide has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, etc.

Heide has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, Heide hopes to save money to financially support immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Hamzali

texts.ru:
Хамзали мужчина мужчина в возрасте 39 лет. У него большая семья, жена и четверо детей. Жена домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Хамзали всю свою жизнь занимается выращиванием скота, также он работает на стройке. Но то, что он зарабатывает на стройке все уходит на проживание. От откорма скота Хаизали берет хорошую прибыль. Он имеет несколько десятков овец и коз. Хамзали старается развивать свой бизнес по животноводству.
 У него очень большие планы на будущее, в этом году Хамзали хочет чтобы его сын поступил в университет и получил высшее образование. Для этого копит деньги. 
Сейчас он хочет расширить свой бизнес по откармливанию скота и решил подать заявку на кредит. Чтобы увеличить поголовье скота Хамзали на полученный кредит планирует купить еще несколько голов мелко рогатого скота. Надеется с помощью кредита Хамзали осуществит сои планы.
texts.en:
Hamzali is a man of the age of 39. He has a large family, a wife and four children. His wife is a housewife and is engaged with raising the children. Hamzali has worked with livestock breeding his whole life, and he also works in construction. However everything he earns from construction goes to living costs. 

Hamzali gets a good income from raising livestock. He has a few dozen sheep and goats. Hamzali tries to develop his livestock breeding business. He has very big plans for the future: This year Hamzali wants his son to be enrolled at the university and start higher education. He is saving up money for this.
