She sells at the Meridiela market, at fairs in surrounding villages and through home sales. She sells retail for cash and credit to both men and women customers.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 95,000 FCFA she will use to invest in the business and repay the loan.

loans.use: Buy grain cereals

loans.name: Djefafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Djekafo est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30  ans et 3 enfants.  Elles vivent toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Méridièla, un des villages du cercle de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Afin de  renforcer leurs capacités financières pour de mieux faire leurs commerces, elles ont adhérés à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur sixième  prêt. Les  précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales,  de condiments, de beignets et de la restauration.
Diatou  assise papier en main,  fait l’achat vente de condiments. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 3 cartons de cube Maggi, 2 sacs d’oignons, 2 colis d’épices et  ½  sac de sel de cuisine auprès des grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché de Méridièla, dans les foires des villages environnants  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Djekafo group consists of six married women who on average are 30 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in Meridiela, one of the villages around Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity and improve their businesses, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution  where they are on their sixth loan. Previous loans have been repaid in full. This group of women trade in grain cereals, condiments, fried cakes and catering.

Diatou is sitting and holding a document. She buys and sells condiments and intends to use the loan to buy three boxes of Maggi cubes, two bags of onions, two packages of spices and a half-bag of salt from wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells her products at the Meridiela market, at fairs in surrounding villages and through home sales. She sells retail for cash and credit to both men and women customers.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 45.000 FCFA she will use to invest in the business and repay the loan.

loans.use: Buy condiments

loans.name: Kodon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Kodon est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et  3 enfants. Elles vivent  toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à Méridièla, un des villages du cercle de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Afin de  renforcer leurs capacités financières pour de mieux faire leurs commerces, elles ont adhérés à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième  prêt. Les  précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments,  de de céréales et de la restauration.
Doussouba, debout papier en main,  fait l’achat et la vente de condiments. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  2 paniers de poissons séchés et fumés  et 1 carton de concentrée de tomate auprès de grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché de Méridièla, dans les foires des villages environnants  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Kodon group is made up of 6 women who are all married and have an average age of 30 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in traditional families in Méridièla, one of the villages in the Bougouni Circle. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and professional relationships, and friendships. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could better conduct their business and are on their 3rd group loan. The previous loans have been properly repaid. This group of women sells condiments, cereals and prepared food.

Doussouba, who is standing and holding paperwork, buys and sells condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 baskets of dried and smoked fish and one box of tomato concentrate from the wholesalers. She makes her sales at the Méridièla market, at the markets in the surrounding villages and door-to-door, for cash or credit to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy 2 baskets of dried and smoked fish and one box of tomato concentrate.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Sabougnouma est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29  ans et 3 enfants.  Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles à Méridièla, un des villages du cercle de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Afin de  renforcer leurs capacités financières pour de mieux faire leurs commerces, elles ont adhérés à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième  prêt. Les  précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales,  de condiments, d’arachide et de la restauration.
Setou  assise papier en main,  fait de la restauration. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, ½  cartons de cube Maggi, 1 sac de riz et  1 colis constitué de diverses d’épices des grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes  c’est à dire ses plats alimentaires au marché de Méridièla et dans les foires des villages environnants, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group is composed of 6 women who are all married and have an average age of 29 and, on average, 3 children. They mostly live in traditional families in Méridièla, one of the villages in the Bougouni Circle. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and professional relationships, and friendships. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could better run their businesses, and are on their 3rd loan. The previous loans have been properly reimbursed. This group of women sells cereals and condiments, groundnuts and prepared food.

Setou, who is sitting and holding paperwork, has a restaurant business. She plans to use her loan to buy half a box of Maggi stock cubes, 1 bag of rice and a package of various spices from the Bougouni wholesalers. She sells her meals at the Méridièla market and at the markets of the surrounding villages, for cash or credit to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 42 000 francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for constructing a dairy unit.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Luis se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de Computación e Informática, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Pallares con Seco para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis trabaja como técnico de campo en una empresa de sanidad de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, Luis se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y responsabilidad.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de matrícula e inscripción para continuar con sus estudios de computación, de esta manera él desea culminar sus estudios a fin de poder postular a una carrera militar, ya que sueña con servir a su patria.
texts.en:
Luis is a 19 year old young man. He is single and lives in the city of Ica in the district of Santiago with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hardworking  and enthusiastic person who really wants to get ahead. Thanks to his hard work and the support of his parents, Luis is studying Computers and Information. In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and sometimes he cooks a delicious pallares con seco to share with his family. 

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication. Luis works as a field technician in a sanitation company in his city. He works every day starting very early in the morning and for about 8 hours. Luis is content doing his job and he believes that it is going well for him because of his hard work and responsibility.

Luis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to cover the costs of registration and tuition to continue with his computer studies. This is the way he wants to finish his studies and begin a military career, since he dreams of serving his country.

loans.use: to cover education expenses.

loans.name: Ada Argentina

texts.es:
Ada Argentina es una mujer casada que de su matrimonio tiene un hijo el cual es menor de edad. Junto a su esposo trabajan en la agricultura especialmente el cultivo y siembra de café, actividad que realiza hace mas de 10 años ya que desde pequeña fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la agricultura misma actividad que hasta hoy en día siguen ejerciendo sus padres. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completa pero no pudo seguir estudiando ya que los ingresos que sus padres obtenían eran muy pocos. Actualmente su esposo y ella son apoyo mutuo para salir adelante del cual depende su único hijo. El cultivo de café queda a una distancia de 200 metros de su casa de habitación por lo cual se trasladan a pie hasta sus cultivos.

Ada Argentina está solicitando ayuda para compra de fertilizante, abono, bombas de fumigación para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, mismo que si no se le da mantenimiento y cuidado a tiempo puede ser dañado por la roya enfermedad que afecta especial mente esta clase de cultivo.  

Ella sueña con educar a su hijo para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo ya que el trabajo de la tierra es muy pesado y con tanta contaminación ambiental y la falta de materiales para el cuido las ganancias que quedan son pocas pero de esta forma ella podrá preparar y fortalecer su cultivo y tener una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
Ada Argentina is a married woman who from her marriage has one minor child. With her husband, she works in farming, especially in growing coffee. She has done this activity for more than 10 years, since when she was young her parents taught her to work in farming, an activity they still do today. She has one year of primary education but was unable to keep going to school because her parents' income was very low. Right now, she and her husband mutually support each other to get ahead, something their only child depends on. The coffee crop is 200 meters from their house and so she walks to get there. 

Ada Argentina is asking for help to buy fertilizer, manure, and fumigation pumps to maintain her coffee crop. If she doesn't maintain it and care for it, it can be damaged by blight, a disease that especially affects this type of crop.   

She dreams of raising her son to have a better quality of life and better work opportunities, since working the land is very hard and with so much pollution and lack of materials to care for the crops the earnings can be low. However, this way, she can prepare and strengthen her crop and have an excellent harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and fumigation pumps to maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 42 years old and married with two children.
She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Liza is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.
Liza has been raising pigs for 16 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction).
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jose Arturo

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 31 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, José no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de sus padres, quienes le enseñaron su labor, José trabaja como en su pequeño negocio de elaboración y venta de panes, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
José se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una pequeña moto, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder hacer la entrega de sus deliciosos panes en diferentes lugares, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una gran panadería y así poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
José is 31 year old man. He is single and lives in the city of Ica in the district of Santiago. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who really wants to get ahead. Lamentably, because of a lack of financial resources, and out of a need to work to support his parents, José was unable to study the the major of education, but he really would have liked to do so. In his free time, he likes to watch television and sometimes cook a delicious arroz chaufa to share with his family. 

With much hard work and dedication and thanks to the support of his parents, who taught him his craft, José works in his small business making and selling bread. He works every day starting very early and can work for about 10 hours. He is happy doing his work and believes that it is going well for him because of the friendly treatment he gives his customers. 

José is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to buy a small motorcycle. This will help him be able to deliver his delicious bread  in different places. This way, he can keep working and striving to achieve his dream os having a great bread bakery and getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is 39 years old, married and a mother of four children. For the last year, she has earned a living by selling fish in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000.

Kadzo was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 to buy additional stocks of fish to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand her business.

Her goal for the future is to own a fish depot in the area.

loans.use: to buy stock of fish for sale.

loans.name: Norjeda

texts.en:
Norjeda is 43 years old, married with four children. All of her children are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.
Norjeda has a barber shop in the Philippines. Norjeda requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy supplies for her barber shop.
Norjeda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Norjeda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her barber shop.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is a 55-year-old married man and father of seven grown children from Ubay, Bohol. He earns a living through his motorcycle transport business. He transports passengers from one place to another.
Ruel is asking for a loan to buy fuel for the motorcycle.
In the future, Ruel hopes of expanding his business and exploring other ventures to augment his income.

loans.use: to buy fuel for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 26 years old. She is married and has one child who is in school.
Melissa is in the agricultural business, farming fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Melissa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.
Melissa has been farming fruits and vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Melissa would like to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies to continue farming fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki, age 38, is married and has three children. She lives with her husband and their children in Kaloleni, Kenya in a rental house. She owns a food kiosk. She is selling a variety of food and groceries.

She has three years of experience in this business. She sells fried chicken, wheat bread, tea and soft drinks. She has requested a loan of KSH 20,000 to buy food ingredients, wheat flour and sacks of potatoes.
She is grateful for the opportunity and hopes this will help improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food items, wheat flour and sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Sharavnyam

texts.en: Mr. Sharavnyam is 54 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a house in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Oyunchimeg used to work in various fields and is now helping her husband produce metal products. Their children Zoljargal and Azjargal are married and live on their own. Sharavnyam has started his own business producing metal products and is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase equipment and tools to run his new business smoothly. He and his wife both are hardworking and welcoming people.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools to operate his metal products business.

loans.name: Antasia

texts.en:
Antasia reports that with the previous loan she has been able to increase her working capital and pay part of her children's school fees. She is now taking another loan to buy more eggs and tomatoes.
She says that she is happy for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like eggs and tomatoes.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 32 years old and married with five children.
Maribel works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of nipa to sell.
Maribel has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been buying and selling nipa for 8 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish, shrimps, crabs, etc.
Maribel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy additional stocks of nipa to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Rosalie

texts.en:
Ma. Rosalie is 36 years old, married and has three children who are all in school.
Ma. Rosalie raises pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Rosalie requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
Ma. Rosalie has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Ma. Rosalie would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juana Anita

texts.en:
Juana Anita is 69-years-old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Juana Anita has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Juana Anita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: A 51-year-old farmer, Andrea has been engaged in the rice farming business together with her husband for more than ten years now. She helps her husband in tilling and overseeing their field. She is now in need of additional capital for the business. She is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Andrea is optimistic that this loan could help her in improving their farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 33 years old. She lives in the Khashuri District with husband Badri and their 2 sons. Madona requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected because of their low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 0.3 acres of agricultural lands, where maize and haricot are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.
Madona requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, which do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Madona will buy a milk cow. After purchasing a milk cow, Madona plans to produce dairy products to sell. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and produce dairy products for selling.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 2 children that are 5 and 8 years old. She describes herself to be hard working. She operates a general store where she sells household items and cereals.  She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy cereals and household items. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.  She has just successfully repaid a loan of KES 50,000.

loans.use: to buy cereals for her store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 47 years old, married with three children. Gina works very hard to provide for them.
Gina runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.
Gina has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, diapers and other groceries.
In the future Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more textiles to make school uniforms for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for making ladies' accessories.

loans.name: Celine

texts.en: Celine is a 28-year-old farmer from CPG, Bohol, Philippines. She has been growing rice for more than four years now. She works hard in order to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. Celine is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for making cassava cake.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 41 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from a general store. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is 76 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as oil, bread, sugar, spices and other groceries needed in her business.

Constancia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as oil, bread, sugar, spices and other groceries needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more snacks to sell.

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor is 73 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Eleanor runs a tobacco-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell.

Eleanor has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Eleanor would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 30 years old. She owns a boutique and has been selling different items. With the loan, she wants to buy more retail items for sale. She plans to reinvest the profits into her retail business.

loans.use: To buy more retail items for sale.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo earns a living through his sari-sari (variety) store business where he sells various items and goods in CPG, Bohol. 

Danilo is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, rice, coffee, beverages, soap and toiletries. This loan would allow him to attract more buyers to his store, thus giving him the chance to improve his sales and income.

In the future, Danilo hopes to make his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save enough money for the repayment of his loan.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, rice, coffee, beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Tserendulam

texts.en: Mrs. Tserendulam is 51 years old and lives with her husband and son in a small house in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Baatar, age 51, is disabled and stays at home. Her son Erdenebolor works at a local hospital in the emergency department. Tserendulam has been running a tailoring business with her partner for 12 years, and now she is starting her own tailoring business in a rental space. She has gained many regular customers over the years. Tserendulam requests a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase an electric sewing machine to successfully run her own tailoring service. She is a hardworking, friendly, and responsible woman.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Cecilia Martire

texts.es:
La Sra. Cecilia vive en Libertad, tiene 42 años de edad. Ella empezó desde pequeña trabajando con su familia en la elaboración y venta de hamacas gorras y sombreros de paja toquilla, desde ese entonces le gusto mucho lo que hacía y en la actualidad tiene puesto su propio negocio.

Esta elaboración de estos productos la realiza junto al esposo y a sus hijos, tiene tres hijos el mayor tiene 17 años, el otro 14 que estudian en colegio fiscal y un pequeño de un año de edad que aun no estudia. 

Esta trabajo lo realiza diariamente dese las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 20:00 de la noche, ella junto a su esposo se esfuerzan para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, con la ayuda de Dios su negocio avanza poco a poco vendiendo sobreros de paja toquilla, redes, amacas.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar paja toquilla, redes. En el futuro quiere ampliar estructuralmente su hogar y tener un local propio en donde pueda realizar sus ventas con tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Cecilia, age 42, lives in Libertad.  When she was little, she started working with her family making hammocks, caps, and straw hats.  She liked what she was doing very much, and she has now set up her own business.

She makes these products with her husband and their children.  She has three children.  The oldest is 17, the next is 14 and goes to public school, and she has a little one year old that does not go to school yet.

She does this work every day from 8:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night.  She and her husband put forth great effort in order to get their three children ahead.  With God’s help, her business of selling straw hats, netting, and hammocks is advancing little by little.

She wants to use the loan to buy straw for hats and netting.  In the future she wants to structurally expand her home.  She also wants to have her own place where she would be able to make her sales peacefully.

loans.use: to buy straw for hats, netting, and hammocks.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre de 36 años,  vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus hijos, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus pequeños, ya que él es padre y madre para ellos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, ya que eran varios hermanos, Julio no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Julio trabaja por las tardes como técnico de artefactos y por las mañana trabaja vendiendo pescado en su pequeño triciclo, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Julio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de llantas nuevas para su triciclo, ya que las que tiene actualmente están deteriorada, de esta manera Julio podrá llegar a lugares más lejanos para ofrecer su producto, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julio, 36, lives in the city of Ica, Santiago district, together with his children, who he loves and are his main motivation in life. Julio is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person that fights to provide his children with a good future. He is both a father and a mother to them.

Unfortunately, because of the lack of money and the need to work in order to help his parents support the family (composed of various siblings), Julio could not finish primary school, although he would have liked to have done. During his free time he likes to watch television and sometimes he cooks a delicious ceviche for the entire family.

With effort and dedication, Julio works repairing different types of devices in the evening and in the morning he sells fish on a wheeled cart. He works approximately twelve hours every day and he thinks he does well because of the good prices he offers and the nice way he treats his customers.

Julio appreciates the help that Kiva lenders give him, which he will use to buy wheels for his cart, since the ones he has at the moment are worn out. With this improvement, Julio will be able to travel to more distant places to offer his products and will keep working and trying hard to make his dream come true: to give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy wheels for his cart.

loans.name: Velena

texts.en:
Velena is 46. She is married and has four children. 

Recently, Velena established another business of selling beers and this this business is booming so far. 

She has decided to request a loan to buy more beers for sale. With the profits, she wants to reinvest in the same business of a pub.

loans.use: To buy more beers for sale.

loans.name: Maa Narayani Self Help Group

texts.en:
Sulochana is 46 years old, married and has children. She lives in the village of Khurda district in Odisha, India. Sulochana is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with her work in her business. 

She has a business of running an auto rickshaw in the Khurda district of Odisha, India. She already had this business for four years, and it is going very well. At this time, Sulochana is requesting a loan to buy new auto rickshaw and hire a driver for that. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business.

This group is made up of neighbours and friends who formed the group Maa Narayani Self Help Group. The members of the group have selected Sulochana as their president. The lady standing second from the left side in the photo is Sulochana. The common goal of the group is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to purchase a new auto rickshaw for her transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn, 45, is married and has three children. One is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jesselyn has a tailoring shop business in the Philippines. Jesselyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring shop.

Jesselyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Jesselyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Maria Johanna

texts.es:
ella es  María Johana esta es su historia ella nacio el 3 de marzo de 1990 en Colombia. Ingreso a Centro MYA el 7 de julio de 1999. Esta institución es una fundación dedicada desde 1965 a la atención integral de población en condición de discapacidad cognitiva remitidos bajo medida de protección por el Instituto Colombiano de Bienestar Familiar, tiene una discapacidad física llamada hemiparesia, es un tipo de parálisis cerebral o de insuficiencia motora de origen central que afecta la movilidad y formación muscular de mi mano y pie izquierdo. Pese a esta condición, ha logrado desenvolverme en muchos contextos sociales, ya que puede desplazarme de manera independiente, bailar, cantar, jugar y estudiar. Junto a mis estudios de bachillerato logré titularme como técnica en sistemas del SENA. Toda su familia es Centro MYA, allí convive con 220 compañeros que al igual que ella  presentan alguna discapacidad, y que en este momento junto al equipo profesional de la fundación se encuentran orgullosos de sus logros y expectativas para el futuro, ya que es la única joven que se ha logrado graduar como bachiller, esto teniendo en cuenta que su compromiso cognitivo es leve. Hoy su  principal sueño es estudiar, llegar a profesionalizarse y lograr forjar una vida independiente a través de la cual pueda ayudar a mis compañeros y mejorar en general su calidad de vida ella no tiene ningun referente de su familia biologica pero de su familia del cento MYA puede 
 decir que han sido un gran apoyo ante las adversidades que ha tenido que atravesar y son su inspiración para hoy decir convencida a Kiva y Campoalto: por favor ayúdenme a seguir estudiando
texts.en:
María Johanna was born on March 3, 1990 in Colombia. On July 7, 1999 she started at Centro MYA, a foundation devoted since 1965 to the comprehensive care of people with cognitive disabilities who are referred as a protective measure by the Instituto Colombiano de Bienestar Familiar (Colombian Institute for Family Welfare). She has a physical disability called "hemiparesia", which is a kind of brain paralysis or motor insufficiency with a central origin that affects mobility and muscular development in the left hand and foot. Despite this condition, she has been able to get along in many social contexts, as she can move independently, dance, sing, play and study. Together with her high-school diploma, she graduated as a systems technician at SENA. Centro MYA is her whole family and there she lives with 220 friends who also have some kind of disability. All of them, together with the professional team of the foundation, are proud of her achievements and expectations for the future, as she's the only young woman who has graduated from high-school even with her mild cognitive engagement.

As of today, her biggest dream is to study, become a professional and be able to create an independent life to help her friends and improve their quality of life. She doesn't have any biological family, but her family at MYA has been a great support through tough times and is her inspiration to ask Kiva and Compoalto with determination: "please, help me to continue studying".

loans.use: to study her first semester in comprehensive early childhood care in Campoalto.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tièssiri est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30  ans et 2 enfants.  Elles vivent toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Méridièla, un des villages du cercle de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Afin de  renforcer leurs capacités financières pour de mieux faire leurs commerces, elles adhérent à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier  prêt.  Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales,  du tricotage et de la vente des poissons.
Mah  debout papier en main,  fait l’achat vente de poissons. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 3 colis de poissons fumés  auprès des grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché de Méridièla, dans les foires des villages environnants  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Tièssiri group is made up of 4 women who are all married and have an average age of 30 and, on average, 2 children. They all live in traditional families in Méridièla, one of the villages in the Bougouni Circle. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and professional relationships, and friendships. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could better run their businesses, and are on their 1st loan. This group of women sells cereals, knitting and fish.

Mah, who is standing and holding paperwork in the photo, buys and sells fish. She plans to use her loan to buy 3 packages of smoked fish from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales at the Méridièla market, at the markets of the surrounding villages and door-to-door, for cash or credit to a retail clientèle composed of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 21 000 francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Yeredeme est constitué de 7 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent  toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à Méridièla, un des villages du cercle de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Afin de  renforcer leurs capacités financières pour de mieux faire leurs commerces, elles ont adhérés à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième  prêt. Les  précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce    de beignets et de la restauration.
Mah, debout papier en main,  fait la vente de la viande cuite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  2 moutons auprès des paysans. Elle effectue ses ventes (viande cuite) au marché de Méridièla, dans les foires des villages environnants  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Tièssiri group is composed of 7 women who are all married and have an average age of 24 and, on average, 2 children. They all live in traditional families in Méridièla, one of the villages in the Bougouni Circle. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and professional relationships, and friendships. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could better run their businesses and are on their 3rd loan. The previous loans were correctly reimbursed. This group of women sells doughnuts and prepared food.

Mah, who is standing and holding paperwork in the photo, sells cooked meat. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 sheep from the farmers. She makes her sales of cooked meat at the Méridièla market, at the markets of the surrounding villages and door-to-door, for cash or credit to a retail clientèle composed of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20 000 francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Yeredon est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41  ans et 3 enfants.  Elles vivent toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Méridièla, un des villages du cercle de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Afin de  renforcer leurs capacités financières pour de mieux faire leurs commerces, elles ont adhérés à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur neuvième  prêt. Les  précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales,  de beignets et de la restauration.
Konimba  debout papier en main,  fait de la préparation vente de beignets. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 10 sacs de mil, 1 sac de sucre et quelques petits sachets d’épices auprès des grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché de Méridièla, dans les foires des villages environnants  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Yeredon group is made up of 4 women who are all married and have an average age of 41 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in traditional families in Méridièla, one of the villages in the Bougouni Circle. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and professional relationships, and friendships. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could better run their businesses and are on their 9th loan. The previous loans have been properly repaid. This group of women sells cereals, doughnuts and prepared food.

Konimba, who is standing and holding paperwork in the photo, prepares and sells doughnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 bags of millet, one bag of sugar and some small packets of spices from the Bougouni wholesalers. She makes her sales at the Méridièla market, at the markets of the surrounding villages and door-to-door, for cash or credit to a retail clientèle composed of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 95 000 francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients with which to make doughnuts.

loans.name: Karina Edith

texts.es:
Karina es una mujer de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su pequeña hija de 6 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeña, ya que Karina es madre y padre para ella; gracias a su esfuerzo Karina pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación Artística, ahora ella se encuentra tramitando su título profesional, con el deseo de poder dar clases de danzas en diversos centros educativos de su ciudad.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Karina trabaja  en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas y abarrotes, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y ocupa en un pequeño espacio en la casa de sus padres, ya que aun no tiene casa propia, Karina cree que le va bien por bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Karina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de bebidas, como gaseosas, refrescos, aguas minerales y otros, de esta manera Karina tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia y así poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Karina is 33 years old. She lives in the city of Ica, in the Santiago district, with her young six year old daughter, whom she loves and who is her main reason for living.  Karina is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person.  She puts all her effort into help her young one prosper, as Karina is both mother and father to her.  Thanks to her own efforts, Karina was able to study art education and she is now applying for her full certificate, so as to teach dance classes in various education centres in the city.

With a lot of determination and dedication, Karina works in her small business where she sells drinks and groceries.  She works every day for around twelve hours.  She uses a small space in her parents' house, as she does not have her own.  Karina thinks the business is going well because of the friendly service she provides to customers.

Karina is very grateful to Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help provided, she will be able to buy a bigger quantity of drinks, such as sodas, juices, water and more.  With this Karina will have her business better stocked and she will be able to serve more customers.  Then she will continue working and putting in the effort to achieve her big dream of having her own house and prospering.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jamuna Mahila Self Help Group

texts.en:
The Jamuna Mahila Self Help Group (SHG) has 10 members who are all from the same neighbourhood. The lady standing in the front, wearing a red saree in the photo is Rojalini who is the leader of the group. Rojalini is a 29-year-old woman married to a worker in Khurda village in Odisha, India. The couple has one child who is in school. 

Rojalini lives with her child and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. In order to help with the family expenses, Rojalini has been selling vegetables and other household commodities in her shop. She buys her inventory from a farmer in her village and some times she herself grows vegetables.

In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Rojalini, together with the group Jamuna Mahila SHG, is requesting a loan from Peoples Forum. Rojalini's  goal is to increase her business activity by purchasing more vegetable seeds, fertilizers, pesticides etc. for growing vegetables.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing vegetable seeds, fertilizers, pesticides etc. to grow vegetables for her vegetable shop.

loans.name: Baba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Baba est un homme marié de 39 ans et père de 4 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez lui même à Bougouni dans le quartier Hérémakono Centre. 
Dû à la pauvreté de ses parents, il décide d’abandonner l’école en classe de 4ème année fondamentale, (système éducatif Malien) au profit des activités génératrices de revenus. Ainsi pendant des années il a mené plusieurs activités sans succès, mais finalement il décida de se spécialiser dans  l’achat et la vente des bois de construction depuis maintenant  plus de 20 ans. Il a appris cette activité auprès d’un de ses amis.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires il décide d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son  1 er  prêt.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 90 planches de bois composé de différentes dimensions( 2 mètres, 3 mètres, 4 mères et 6 mètres).  Il s’aprovisionne à Gueya (en république de Côte d’Ivoire). Ses bois sont vendus à Bougouni et à Bamako. Sa clientèle est composée de menuisiers, de maçons et de revendeurs. Il compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Baba is a 39-year-old married man and the father of four children. He lives with his wife and children at his own place in Bougouni in the district of Hérémakono Centre. Due to the poverty of his parents, he decided to drop out of primary school in the 4th year (Malian education system) to benefit from revenue-generating work. Thus, for years, he ran several businesses unsuccessfully but finally decided to specialize in the buying and selling of construction lumber twenty years ago. He learned this business from one of his friends. 

While looking for additional financial resources, he decided to join the loan program at the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first loan.

He plans on using this loan to purchase 90 boards of different dimensions (2, 3, 4, and 6 meters). He gets his supplies in Gueya (in the Republic of Cote d’Ivoire). His lumber is sold in Bougouni and in Bamako. His customer base is composed of furniture makers, masons, and retailers. 

With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA. With the profits, he envisions expanding his enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase lumber for construction

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bakary est un homme marié de 39 ans et père de 6 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez lui même dans le quartier Dougounina de Bougouni.
Ayant abandonné l’école moderne en classe de 5ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) très vite, il commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des mèches, de pomades et des habits de toutes catégories. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle. Avec une expérience de plus de 10 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Pour renforcer son commerce, il décide d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour prendre un prêt afin d’acheter 10 cartons de  mèches de diverses qualités, 15 cartons de pomades de différentes  qualités et quelques douzaines d’habits pour enfants. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). La vente de ses articles se fait dans sa boutique située au coeur grand marché de Bougouni. Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Il est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Avec ce prêt il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice il compte agrandir sa boutique, payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Bakary is 39 years old, married and the father of 6 children. He lives with his wife and children in their home in the district of Dougounina, in Bougouni. Having quickly left school in the 5th year of basic education (in the Malian education system), he started doing revenue-generating activities, namely the buying and selling of hair extensions, creams and all sorts of clothing. He learnt his trade at his uncle's side. He is a master of his business, with over 10 years of experience.

In order to strengthen his business, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and get a loan with which to buy 10 boxes of hair extensions of varying quality, 15 boxes of creams of differing quality and a dozen sets of clothing for children. He gets his supplies in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). He makes his sales from his shop, located at the centre of the Bougouni Grand Market. His customer base is essentially made up of women. This is his first experience with Soro Yiriwaso. Using this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 75 000 francs. He plans to use the profit to expand his shop, pay the loan interest and meet his needs.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, creams and clothes.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou est une voeuve de 47 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit avec ses enfants dans la consession de son feu époux dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni. 
Ayant vite abandonnée l’école dès à son jeune âge,  elle décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus notamment  l’achat et la vente d’habits pour enfants. 
Avec plus de 10 ans d’expérience, elle maîtrise son activité. Elle a appris cette activité dès son âge auprès de sa mère. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Fatou intégra Soro Yiriwaso. Après 4 prêts individuels tous correctement remboursés,  elle est à son 5ème prêt  qui servira à acheter, 10 douzaines d’habits pour enfants. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (Capitale de la République du Mali) et effectue ses ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt et agrandir son entreprise et subvenir aux dépenses familialle.
texts.en:
Fatou is a 47-year-old widow and the mother of 5 children. She lives with her children in the concession of her late husband in the district of Torakabougouin, in Bougouni. Having left school quickly at a young age, she decided to engage in revenue-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of children's clothes. She is very knowledgeable in her line of work, with over 10 years experience. She learnt her trade at a young age working alongside her mother.

Fatou decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy her growing clientèle. After 4 individual loans which have all been properly repaid, she is on her 5th loan which will be used to buy 10 dozen articles of clothing for children. She gets her supplies in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) and makes her sales for cash or credit, to a mixed and diverse retail clientèle. She expects to make a monthly profit of 35 000 francs, which will be used to pay off the loan, increase her business and cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de 31 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que lamentablemente Nancy es viuda; en sus ratos libres le gusta realizar pequeños trabajos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Nancy trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Nancy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá pagar la cuota inicial para adquirir un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado central de su ciudad, de esta manera adicionalmente Nancy podrá poner en marcha un negocio y con dicho ingresos desea poder lograr su gran sueño de  brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nancy is 31 years old and lives in the city of Pisco.  She lives with her two young children whom she loves and who are her main reason for living.  She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who puts all her efforts into helping the family prosper.  Sadly Nancy is a widow.  In her spare time she likes to do little bits of work and on some occasions she will cook a delicious "Carapulcra con Sopa Seca" (a traditional stew and soup from the south of Peru) to share with her family.

Using her own initiative, and with determination and dedication, Nancy is a field worker at a farm in her city.  She works from very early in the morning for around eight hours.  She likes doing her work and thinks it is going well because of her good work and for the kind way she treats others.

Nancy is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help provided, she will be able to put down a deposit for a small stall and the city's central market.  With this Nancy will be able to start up a business and, with the income, she wants to achieve her great dream of providing her children with a better up-bringing.

loans.use: to put money down on a market stall.

loans.name: Agustina Simona

texts.es:
Agustina es una mujer de 31 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposo y su pequeña hija de 5 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Agustina pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Obstetricia, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo al Ajo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Agustina trabaja como Obstetra en una posta médica de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas, Agustina se siente a gusto realizando su labor, ya que siempre  le ha gustado ayudar a los demás.
Agustina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá iniciar la construcción de su vivienda, ya que desea construir paredes para poder cercarla e ir avanzando poco a poco, así pues Agustina seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder brindar una buena calidad de vida para su pequeña, ya que ella sufre una penosa enfermedad.
texts.en:
Agustina is a 31-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Nazca with her husband and her small 5-year-old daughter, whom she loves and is her main reason for living. She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic woman, who with her husband dedicates all of her efforts to keeping her family going. Thanks to her efforts and the support of her parents, Agustina was able to study for a professional degree in obstetrics. In her free moments she likes to distract herself by watching television and in a few occasions she cooks a very delicious garlic chicken to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, Agustina works with much determination and dedication as an obstetrician in a medical post in her city. She works every day for approximately 8 hours. Agustina feels comfortable in her job since she has always liked to help others.

Agustina is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help provided, she will be able to start the construction of her home. She wants to construct walls to be able to enclose her home and advance little by little. Thus, Agustina will continue working and exerting herself to be able to achieve her greatest dream of being able to provide a good quality of life for her little one, since she suffers from a terrible illness.

loans.use: to start the construction of her home.

loans.name: Cayo

texts.es:
Cayo es un hombre de 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa e hijos, a quienes y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Cayo inició sus estudios para convertirse en Profesor, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad trabajar, Cayo no pudo culminar sus estudios, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta leer un poco y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cuy Chactado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Cayo trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Cayo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, como abarrotes, bebidas y útiles escolares, de esta manera Cayo tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para logra su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Cayo is a 45-year-old man who lives in the city of Ica with his wife and children. His family is his motivation in life. He is a kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, and both he and his wife work very hard to provide a good life for their family. Cayo started studying to become a teacher, but due to lack of financial support and needing to work, Cayo could not finish his studies, although he would still like to. In his free time, he likes to read a little and sometimes cooks a delicious Cuy Chactado (fried guinea pig) for his family.

Cayo works hard running his convenience store -  a business that he started alone. He works every day from early in the morning and works for around 12 hours. He enjoys his job and his business is doing well because he offers good prices and treats his customers well. 
Cayo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help, he will be able to buy items such as dry goods, drinks, and school supplies so that his store is better-stocked and he can sell to more customers. He will carry on working and doing his best to achieve his dream of seeing his children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his store.

loans.name: Johana Esmix

texts.es:
Johana es una joven de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Johana ha podido estudiar una pequeña carrera de repostería, en sus ratos libres le gusta preparar deliciosos postres para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hacer dos años, Johana trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de cuyes.
Johana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de palos, plásticos, maya metálica, comedero y otros, de esta manera Johana podrá construir un pequeño corral para sus cuyes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar la carrera profesional de Secretariado  y así desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Young Johana is 20 years old.  She is single and lives in the city of Imperial with her parents and siblings.  She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person, with a great desire to move ahead.  Thanks to her efforts and the support of her parents, Johana was able to study confectionery.  In her spare time she likes to prepare delicious desserts to share with her family.

With her own initiative and a lot of determination and dedication, Johana has now been working as a field labourer for two years at a farm in her city.  She works every day from early in the morning for around eight hours.  In addition she has a small business raising and selling guinea pigs. 

Johana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy straw, plastic, wire-mesh, a feeding-trough and other items  to build a small enclosure for her guinea pigs.  So, she will continue to work and put in the effort to achieve her grand dream of studying to become a secretary and so prosper.

loans.use: to build an enclosure for her guinea pigs.

loans.name: Nafama Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nafama  est constitué de six femmes mariées et trois célibataires. Elles ont  une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 2 enfants et vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies  dans le quartier Hérémakono Centre de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles adhérent à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier  prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  charbon de bois à travers  KOROTOUMOU, qui est la troisième femme assise de la droite vers la gauche.  Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 25 sacs de75 kilos  avec les paysans  des villages environnants de  Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Nafama group is made up of 6 married women and 3 single women. They have an average age of 30 and, on average, 2 children and live in extended, traditional families in the district of Hérémakono Centre, in Bougouni town. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and professional relationships, and friendships. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could better run their businesses and are on their 1st loan. The women in this group sell charcoal via Korotoumou, who is the woman sitting 3rd from the right in the picture. She plans to use her loan to buy 25 75-kilo bags from the farmers of the villages neighbouring Bougouni. She makes her sales at the market and door-to-door, for cash or credit to a retail clientèle composed essentially of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30 000 francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 53 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es madre y padre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, María no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho ser una gran Cosmetóloga, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Picante de Res para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, María trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella prepara deliciosos platos típicos de su ciudad y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de insumos, como arroz por saco, menestras, ollas, platos descartables y otros, de esta manera María tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran restaurante y así desea poder salir adelante al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a 53-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Chincha with her two children, whom she loves and are her main reason for living. She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic woman who dedicates all of her efforts to keeping her family going since she is mother and father to her children. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the necessity to work to pay her expenses, Maria was not able to study for a professional degree. However, it would have very much pleased her to be a great cosmetologist. In her free moments she likes to distract herself by watching movies, and sometimes she cooks a very tasty spicy beef to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, Maria works with much determination and dedication in her small business selling food. She works every day from the early hours of the morning and she can do so for approximately 8 hours. She prepares delicious dishes typical of her city, and she believes that her business is doing well because of her good seasoning and the friendly treatment she provides to her customers.

María is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help provided, she will be able to purchase supplies like rice by the sacksful, beans, pots, disposable plates, and others. Thus, María will have her business set up better, so then she will continue working and striving to achiever her greatest dream of having a great restaurant and so wishes to be able to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame Assitan est une femme mariée de 33 ans et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vit avec ses enfants chez son époux dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni.
Après quelques années d’étude à l’école coranique, elle décida de s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus  notamment à la vente de la pâte  d’arachide  apprise  auprès de sa mère. Avec une expérience de plus 12 ans, elle maîtrise cette activité. Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers un agent de l’institution, elle décide d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à sa première experience.
Pour obtenir un fonds de roulement consistant elle décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin d’acheter 12 sacs d’arachide qui seront transformés en pâte d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni et environnants.  La vente se fait au grand marché de Bougouni et à domicile. Sa clientèle est mixte. 
Madame Assitan est très appréciée et sollicitée dans le marché cela est dù à la qualité de ses pâtes d’arachide. La rotation de son activité est très élévée ce qui lui permettra de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA.
C’est avec ce bénéfice elle ensisage assurer certaines dépenses de la famille et améliorer d’avantage son entreprise.
texts.en:
Ms. Assitan is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She lives with  her children at her husband's place in the Massablacoura district of Bougouni. After several years of Koranic schooling, she decided to interest herself in revenue-generating work, especially in the buying and selling of peanut butter which she learned from her mother. With over twelve years of experience, she has a mastery of this business. 

Having been introduced to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso through an agent of the institution, she decided to join its loan program and is now on her first loan. 

To obtain substantial working capital, she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso to purchase 12 sacks of peanuts that will be processed into peanut butter. She gets her supplies in and around Bougouni. Sales are made to a mix of customers at the big market of Bougouni and at home. 

Ms. Assitan is highly appreciated and much in demand in the market due to the quality of her peanut butter. Her sales rate is very high, and this enables her to make a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA. With the profits, she envisions ensuring that certain family expenses are covered and improving her enterprise further.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine age 34, is a mother of four children. They all attend school. She sells items in her boutique, which she has been running for two years. 

She has requested a loan to buy more items, such as sugar, salt, and soap. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more items, such as sugar, salt, and soap.

loans.name: Assetou

texts.fr:
Madame Assetou est une femme mariée de 39 ans et mère de 7 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni. 
Ayant abandonnée l’école en classe de 5ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien), elle décida d’apprendre les activités génératrices de revenus. C’est ainsi qu’elle a commencé à suivre sa soeur pour apprendre les activités de la préparation et la vente des jus et glace. Elle mène cette activité depuis plusieurs années, la maitrise bien et est très sollicitée dans le quartier pour la qualité de ses jus. Madame Assetou a connu Soro Yiriwaso à travers une voisine du quartier. Vu l’évolution de son activité elle décide de venir à Soro Yiriwaso pour prendre un prêt individuel afin d’augmenter son fonds de roulement. Avec ce premier prêt elle compte acheter, 2 sacs du sucre, 1 carton sucre-vanille, 25 kilos de gingembre et 1 sac de 50 kilos de dah. Elle s’aprovisionne en matières premières dans le marché de Bougouni et à Sikasso qui est la 3ème region administrative du Mali. Ses jus sont vendus par ses employers à la maison, au marché,  devant les écoles et dans les differents quartiers de Bougouni.
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Ms. Assetou is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of seven children. She lives with her husband and children in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni. Having dropped out of primary school in the 5th year (Malian education system), she decided to learn about revenue-generating work. And so she started watching her sister to learn about making and selling juices and ice. She has been operating this business for several years, has mastered it, and is much in demand in the district for the quality of her juices. 

Ms. Assetou knew about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso through a neighbor in her district. Given the evolution of her business, she decided to come to Soro Yiriwaso to take out an individual loan for increasing her working capital. 

With this initial loan, she intends to purchase 2 bags of sugar, a box of vanilla sugar, 25 kg of ginger, and a 50-kg sack of 'dah' (dried hibiscus flowers). She gets her supplies of ingredient at the markets of Bougouni and Sikasso, which is the third administrative region of Mali. Her juices are sold by her employees at the house, at the market, and in front of schools in the different district of Bougouni. 

With this loan, she intends to make a monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be used to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making juices

loans.name: Zile Ywan Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA  est la représentante du groupe ZILE YWAN. Mme se porte bien. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 40ans le moins âgé a 18ans. 03 de ses enfants vont à l’école et elle a 09 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des ignames. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 36ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Léo au BURKINA. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.

Mme veut  s’acheter  04 calebasses d’ignames.

Elle épargne ses bénéfices et s’occupe de la scolarité de ses enfants. Mme ambitionne  ouvrir un grand magasin de stockage d’ignames.
texts.en:
Aminata is the representative of the ZILE YWAN group.  She is doing well.  She is married and the mother of seven children.  Her oldest child is 40 years old, her youngest is 18.  Three of her children are students.  She has nine people in her care.

Aminata has been selling calabashes of yam for the past 36 years.  She stocks up in Léo, Burkina Faso, and sells to men and women.

She currently wants to buy four calabashes of yam.

She saves her profits and takes care of her children's tuition fees.  Her ambition is to open a large shop for yam storage.

loans.use: to buy four calabashes of yam.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Melba has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from fish-vending. Melba has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora tiene su negocio  ubicado en uno de los mercados de chinandega desde hace 17 años en su negocio vende productos de plastico como barriles, pichingas, sacos etc. con su negocio ha sacado adelante a sus hijos ahora son unos profesionales, comenzo con capial propio.

vende de lunes a domingo desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, se esfuerza por tener su negocio lleno de producto para ofrecerles a sus clientes, con sus ingresos de sus ventas ha mejorado su calidad de vida,  antes solo vendia sacos vacios y usados. se siente muy agradecida con los financiamientos que le hemos brindado ya que  su negocio se oxigena de este credito cada dos meses.
texts.en:
Maria has had her business, which is located in one of Chinandega's markets, for some 17 years.
